Title: Consumer NBN Operations Manager
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Role with us
Own the delivery of Consumer and small business customer activations leading Telstra SMEs and Industry Partner staff across multiple offshore functions remotely and on-site.
Manage and effectively lead a group of technical staff to ensure the successful operations of the Consumer and Mass Market Activations business based within several Industry Partners in India. Achieve agreed customer service delivery and business targets for associated support functions
Key Accountabilities
Leading a team of Operational leads to identify Operational gaps and patterns, execute troubleshooting exercises across the functional streams
Execute on a ‘Manage by Exception’ model, streamlining the connection experience with specialist groups, whilst maintaining a focus on improving the customer experience
Collaborate across the business to create a feedback loop to ensuring we are identifying areas of pain and leveraging relationships to improve process and customer experience
Driving cross functional efforts to meet Operational KPIs and assist with driving the Offshore Industry Partner achieve key deliverables.
Providing Key Operational input to shape the contractual obligations from a commercials stand point
Develop and maintain tracking and reporting frameworks
Identify, discuss and facilitate resolution of all issues, blockers and staff ideas with the industry partner and internal stakeholders to ensure a cycle of improvement, and development of agents is undertaken.
Identify and address any gaps in process or training
Lead the industry partners to deliver successful customer outcomes by way of meeting SLAs and KPIs.
Manage key blockers or dependencies with relevant stakeholders
Build and maintain solid, productive relationships with industry partners and other operational leads to ensure consistency and improvement across the entire NBN activation episode.
Engage in ongoing reviews of business and IT processes and systems to ensure the company’s evolving operational objectives are met
Guide and support our Industry Partners to achieve SLA performance, customer experience expectations and quality standards within budget.
Build highly effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders
Maintain the business area Operating / Engagement Model, updating it as new situations arise
Accountable for the implementation of new processes & procedures. This may include a small scale, fully operational, implementation of a new process - to learn how to bring the change into complete readiness
Provide technological support in a specialised field through enhanced capabilities
Skills & Experience : 8 + yrs
Mass Market Operations Leadership Team, operational delivery leads, Activation Services (improvement, program, commercial)
project leads, process domains, IT, Sales Channels
Technical Descriptors
Relevant experience in Leading diverse teams
Relevant tertiary qualifications (e.g. business, commercial, management, procurement) coupled with 5 to 10 years demonstrated experience (i.e. considered a specialist in field)
Experience in driving operational improvement programs across third-party service providers, especially in India.
Experience delivering significant cost savings over the life of Partner contracts
Experience engaging and influencing senior stakeholders, both internal and external, to achieve business objectives
Commercial management experience and contribution to solving complex problems.
Proven ability to contribute to and inform strategy development within area of expertise
Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working in a complex, cross functional company such as Telstra
International BPO Experience
Customer engagement and relationship management
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Senior Automation QA Engineer (Remote/Work-from-home)
Description:
WalletHub is one of the leading personal finance destinations in the US and rapidly growing. We’re looking for a motivated, hardworking, and competitive Senior Automation QA Engineer for a full-time, permanent position.
The expected work schedule is 7 AM to 7 PM EST Monday to Friday, including a 1h break.
Responsibilities
Reporting and validating bugs for all components
Creating test plans and test cases
Creating and maintaining automated tests using Selenium and Java
Identifying opportunities for improvement and making constructive suggestions for change
Staying up-to-date with developing technologies and showcasing them in your work
Qualifications
You are the ideal candidate for this job if you have:
At least 3 years of hands-on experience in Test Automation with Java and Selenium
At least 4 years experience in Manual Testing
Excellent attention to details
Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Willingness to work hard
Proficient in written/spoken English
Compensation
Very competitive salary based on prior experience and qualifications
Potential for stock options after the first year
Raise and advancement opportunities based on periodic evaluations
The ability to work overtime for added income
100% remote position
Visa sponsorship (after 24 months with the company, based on performance, in case you will be working from outside the US)
How to apply
To get our attention, all you need to do is apply on Indeed and include your updated resume as well as a brief message telling us why you are the right candidate.If we believe that you will be a good match, we'll contact you to arrange the next steps of the application process.
Please know that we appreciate your interest in our company but due to the high number of applications we are unable to get back to candidates who have not been selected to move forward.
Note
This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed remotely from outside the U.S. without the need for U.S. work authorization.
More about WalletHub
WalletHub is a high-growth fintech company based in Washington, D.C. that is looking for talented, hard-working individuals to help us reshape personal finance. More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:
1) Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.
2) Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.
3) Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.
In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹960,000.00 to ₹2,100,000.00 /year

Title: Web API Developer
Description:
Job Summary
With Agenty.com we're building a fully modern user interface for machine learning with hundreds of different types of automotive agents to automate the data collection, processing, validation, translation, cleaning, and the integration with client applications. Agenty is used by customers in retail, healthcare, machine learning, artificial intelligence and many more industries to bring web data to their business. You'll own building this interface in a customer-centric manner, working directly with founding team and global customers to design and implement features throughout the stack.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR :
- Experience in .Net web API development (MVC, Asp.net and C#)
- Hands on experience building end to end systems
- Experience in writing SQL queries in frameworks like Dapper
- Good knowledge of NoSQL databases like MongoDB, CosmoDB
- Good knowledge of code benchmarking, and unit test in Visual Studio
- Knowledge of AWS Cloud or Microsoft Azure is a plus
Responsibilities and Duties
- Build customer facing web API and integration for global customers in C#, Asp. Net web API & SQL.
- Bug fixes, new feature development.
- Technical documentation, video tutorials and presentations.
- Technical support to solve customers queries
Required Experience, Skills and Qualifications
Asp.net, Web API, C#, SQL Server
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹264,000.00 to ₹300,000.00 /year
Experience:
Asp.Net: 1 year (Required)
work: 1 year (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)
Location:
Gurgaon, Haryana (Required)

Title: Intership for Artificial Intelligence
Description:
Job Summary
In Artificial Intelligence training course you learn Python, Principles of Machine Learning, Deep learning fundamentals with Keras, Deep learning fundamentals with Pytorch, Reinforcement Learning, Speech Recognition Systems, Natural Language Processing, Neural Network, Azure Machine Learning, Chatbot and Tensorflow.
Responsibilities and Duties
By now, we are quite sure you would have understood the roles and responsibilities of data scientists.Machine Learning (ML) scientists build methods for predicting product suggestions and product demand and explore Big Data to automatically extract patterns. Machine learning and Artificial intelligence are integral parts of data science, where techniques from both such as regression, predictive analytics and more are applied. If you are an AI aspirant, you might want to consider more about becoming a machine learning engineer
Qualifications and Skills
AI is the latest buzzword in Tech. All the major enterprises will make use of AI in the future to improve their productivity. Tech giants like Apple, Google and Facebook have already climbed on the bandwagon of AI. So what are you waiting for? Both Data Science and Machine Learning are generating more jobs making these two areas the fastest growing tech employment areas today.
The demand for AI certified professionals will grow along with the developments in AI. Getting trained in AI will give you an edge over other IT professionals as AI is the future of IT.
Benefits
According to the latest industry estimates, an AI professional with an experience of 2-4 years can earn annually ₹ 15-₹ 20 lakhs ($20.6-27.5K). Experienced professionals with 4-8 years can expect up to ₹ 20-₹ 50 lakhs ($20.6-68.8K).
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹18,000.00 to ₹80,000.00 /month

Title: Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About the Job
AI / ML is one of the most exciting technologies of the decade. This role is your opportunity to build and deploy new AI products from the ground up. You will be part of a team helping chart our AI strategy and define the problems we are solving with AI. You will help build our AI development and production infrastructure and set our technical standards. To succeed you must become an expert in building AI models and putting them into production.
Requirements
Have 1+ years of work experience with large volumes of data preferably in healthcare.
Have a formal education in relevant fields such as stats, computer science or applied mathemathics.
Love data. You need to eat, breathe and sleep data. For you, everything has to be measured and data-driven.
You should have a very good understanding of Python and Image processing, and hands-on software development skill from the development to production.
Are an expert at data visualization and presentation.
Have a strong background in statistical concepts and machine learning models.

Title: Vendor Management Lead
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
Manage and effectively lead a group of technical staff to ensure the successful operations of the Mass Market Operations business based within several Industry Partners in India. Achieve agreed customer service delivery and business targets for all associated Fixed wireline and Mobility support functions
This role will be key to enabling the continued evolution of our business model to streamline our Operations in India. You will lead a small but potent team in the ICC that will be accountable for the service delivery performance of our Industry Partners in India for Fixed Wireline and Mobile Activations. You will be accountable for building effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders and the development of the Mass Market operations team in the Innovation Capability Centre as we realign and optimise our service delivery footprint
Key Accountabilities
Guide and support our Industry Partners to achieve SLA performance, customer experience expectations and quality standards within budget.
Oversee performance to Operational KPIs and assist with driving the Industry Partners to achieve key deliverables (see Activation Metrics)
Conduct daily/weekly performance stand-ups with the industry partner leadership teams and act as a conduit between the cross functional teams in Telstra and the partner should there be any escalations
Understand Telstra’s Risk and Compliance Framework (e.g. Privacy risk, Security risk, IT Risk etc.) and support/ facilitate partner in developing suitable Plans to ensure compliance (e.g. Business Continuity Plans)
Ensuring there is no risk to Telstra’s Regulatory obligations – Meet and exceed on the industry regulatory standards [ACMA]
Build highly effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders and the development of the team
Build and maintain solid, productive relationships with industry partners and other operational leads to ensure consistency and improvement across the entire activation episode.
Work with the partners to execute troubleshooting exercises required to ensure order progression, including escalation into dependant groups where required (i.e. Field workforce, Sales, IT)
Identification and resolution of partner pain points, including feedback to the vertical on systemic issues requiring improvement
Monitoring of quality and compliance through presence on the floor – partner with the quality teams to ensure the quality framework meets business needs
Maintain the business area Operating / Engagement Model, updating it as new situations arise
Input into the monthly forecasting process, to ensure the Operational lead has appropriate input to sign off on forecast [i.e. – AHT reviews]
Providing Key Operational input to shape the contractual obligations from a commercial stand point
Ensure effective reporting frameworks are in place to support monitoring of key operational metrics
Co-ordinate post-implementation reviews of projects or plans, and analyse their impact on the achievement of the groups KPIs
Act as the point of contact for any incident management or business continuity events [Downtime due to systems being offline, weather and political events] that severely impact operations
Collaborate with the partner to develop glide paths to recovery based on factual evidence, performance standards and staffing levels and ensure the partner delivers on the stated glide paths
Ensure the partner teams are 100% compliant with all Telstra mandatory training course – i.e. Business Essentials
Accountable for the implementation of new processes & procedures. This may include a small scale, fully operational, implementation of a new process - to learn how to bring the change into complete readiness
Conduct weekly/fortnightly ride-on’s to understand the process gaps and determine improvement opportunities
Develop a 30-60-90-day program of work to improve the partners performance and also undertake analysis, research & diagnosis to identify patterns, trends or issues that need a solution or resolution to be developed
Onsite guidance and support for any future Transition activities. Provide “on-site” health checks for the project team for any transition with the aim of achieving Tollgate on or before plan
Skill & Experience: 8 + yrs
Relevant experience in Leading diverse teams
Relevant tertiary qualifications (e.g. business, commercial, management, procurement) coupled with 5 to 10 years demonstrated experience (i.e. considered a specialist in field)
Experience in driving operational improvement programs across third-party service providers, especially in India.
Experience delivering significant cost savings over the life of Partner contracts
Experience engaging and influencing senior stakeholders, both internal and external, to achieve business objectives
Commercial management experience and contribution to solving complex problems.
Proven ability to contribute to and inform strategy development within area of expertise
Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working in a complex, cross functional company such as Telstra
International BPO Experience

Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Change-Senior Specialist
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future
The Telstra SECs are located across India in various partner locations. These centers operate in hybrid mode along with the partner resources.
This role is for supporting the Enterprise business program running across the centers. This position will work closely with the Technology leads, Stream Manager, Partners, Business units, internal Telstra departments (SEC leads), and will be integral in moving business unit strategy forward.
Responsibilities:
Coordinate with Agile coach, Scrum Master and Tech Leads in identifying wins, messages and stories to be communicated with the teams in parallel to the engineering communications that the team would have with their leads.
Interact with the teams in SEC to bring people together, so we can build cohesive Telstra culture, spread the positiveness and motivating the team to take the lead in driving efficiency.
Interact with the teams to understand the user experience, bring out the positivity and share their story.
Bring together the comms across the geography and help the teams understand the big picture and reemphasize the purpose and the role that the team plays in the transformation journey.
Act as a stimulant in bringing about the enterprise wide change and help with smooth transition by projecting the benefits.
Assist the Engineering leads to document and support inter group presentation. There are often details asked in different formats, and it will help if those details can be shared in the format asked for.
Assist the engineering leads in managing the Metrics - Manage all aspects Engineering Metrics, KPI, capacity planning of SECs, create and generate periodic reports for various business and use case in India.
Work closely with the Digital Transformation in sharing the key achievements, important milestones and employee engagement activities from centers in India. This role will also help collate important communication from across all streams and ensure it reaches the teams in India.
Ensure the proper procedures/documentations are in place. Act as first line of escalation and arrange necessary support as and when clarification is required on local policies, procedures.
Documentation - Serve as the central point of contact for managing all requests for SEC requirements, contracts, exceptions, deficiencies and all the evidentiary documentation that goes along with it in the team’s SharePoint site.
Track timelines as needed for various initiatives within B2B and maintain trackers.
Work with the Engineering leads and the project coordinators to run employee engagement activities and Enterprise stream specific R&R.
Work closely with partner project manager and with ODC feature team leads to ensure smooth Joiner – Leaver process (on boarding of employees), asset management, timely submission of timesheet, completion of mandatory trainings, etc.

Skills Required :
Minimum 8 years professional work experience
3 - 4 years in Enterprise communication, brand building, Organizational Change Management and People engagement activities
3 - 4 years of Project Management experience in Agile (matrix) organizations preferably in a PM/PMO role
Excellent Communication and coordination skill
Strong program management, time management, conflict management, multi-tasking & analytical skills with Agile Scrum and IT infrastructure background.
Discreet and professional with good organizational skills
Articulate, express the thoughts in visual and vocabulary and Extreme attention to detail
Ability to remain calm under pressure
Familiar with Microsoft Office, SharePoint, Teams etc
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit our Telstra Careers Website: tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Consumer and Small Business NBN Delivery Principal
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Role with us
To provide strong direction and leadership in the efficiencies and management of the Consumer & Small Business customer activations operational teams. This includes being responsible for the delivery of performance to customer SLAs and execution to the Commercial KPI targets.
To provide indirect leadership to India partner teams and ensure quality of outcomes to agreed set of operational performance metrics while providing a conduit for the partners into the Activations vertical and associated Stakeholder base.
The role will support and contribute to the line of business direction to improve cost and quality, in addition to providing critical input to key operational pain points to feed into the improvement program of work
Key Accountabilities
Lead the operation of the Consumer & Small Business NBN Delivery team
 Point of escalation for issues unable to be resolved through normal escalation processes
 Focus on quality and reducing customer complaints
 Deliver and report services to SLA’s
o Agree satisfactory SLA’s and budget to deliver – with Activation Services journey owners
 Develop and manage the relationship between Telstra business groups in order to deliver to operational objectives
 People leadership and management
o For direct and vendor/partner resources in India
o Create clarity, climate and competence for both Partner staff and Telstra Staff in the portfolio
o Create and build local talent
 On the ground deployment of improvement initiatives to deliver cost and quality benefits
o Identify opportunities to optimise delivery and informing verticals / other horizontals to maintain consistency and share best practice
o Collaborate and deliver on improvement agenda designed by verticals
 HSE Responsibility: Take reasonable care for your own safety and the safety of others, comply with and
 Implement any reasonable Telstra HSE instruction, policy, standard, minimum requirement or procedure, and support Telstra to meet its duties under the relevant safety and environmental legislation.
Skill & Experience 15 + yrs
Operational management and people management of large dispersed and diverse teams (internal and external)
Customer issues management
Track record of collaborating and influencing people
ITIL Certification
Masters of Business Administration
Experience in building operational excellence
BPO
Comfortable with transparency and continuous improvement
Technical Descriptors
Health Safety and Environment (HSE) Leadership
Recovering from setbacks
Business partnering
Implementing strategy
Customer engagement

Title: Change-Senior Specialist
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
The Telstra SECs are located across India in various partner locations. These centers operate in hybrid mode along with the partner resources.
This role is for supporting the Enterprise business program running across the centers. This position will work closely with the Technology leads, Stream Manager, Partners, Business units, internal Telstra departments (SEC leads), and will be integral in moving business unit strategy forward.
Responsibilities:
Coordinate with Agile coach, Scrum Master and Tech Leads in identifying wins, messages and stories to be communicated with the teams in parallel to the engineering communications that the team would have with their leads.
Interact with the teams in SEC to bring people together, so we can build cohesive Telstra culture, spread the positiveness and motivating the team to take the lead in driving efficiency.
Interact with the teams to understand the user experience, bring out the positivity and share their story.
Bring together the comms across the geography and help the teams understand the big picture and reemphasize the purpose and the role that the team plays in the transformation journey.
Act as a stimulant in bringing about the enterprise wide change and help with smooth transition by projecting the benefits.
Assist the Engineering leads to document and support inter group presentation. There are often details asked in different formats, and it will help if those details can be shared in the format asked for.
Assist the engineering leads in managing the Metrics - Manage all aspects Engineering Metrics, KPI, capacity planning of SECs, create and generate periodic reports for various business and use case in India.
Work closely with the Digital Transformation in sharing the key achievements, important milestones and employee engagement activities from centers in India. This role will also help collate important communication from across all streams and ensure it reaches the teams in India.
Ensure the proper procedures/documentations are in place. Act as first line of escalation and arrange necessary support as and when clarification is required on local policies, procedures.
Documentation - Serve as the central point of contact for managing all requests for SEC requirements, contracts, exceptions, deficiencies and all the evidentiary documentation that goes along with it in the team’s SharePoint site.
Track timelines as needed for various initiatives within B2B and maintain trackers.
Work with the Engineering leads and the project coordinators to run employee engagement activities and Enterprise stream specific R&R.
Work closely with partner project manager and with ODC feature team leads to ensure smooth Joiner – Leaver process (on boarding of employees), asset management, timely submission of timesheet, completion of mandatory trainings, etc.

Skills Required :
Minimum 8 years professional work experience
3 - 4 years in Enterprise communication, brand building, Organizational Change Management and People engagement activities
3 - 4 years of Project Management experience in Agile (matrix) organizations preferably in a PM/PMO role
Excellent Communication and coordination skill
Strong program management, time management, conflict management, multi-tasking & analytical skills with Agile Scrum and IT infrastructure background.
Discreet and professional with good organizational skills
Articulate, express the thoughts in visual and vocabulary and Extreme attention to detail
Ability to remain calm under pressure
Familiar with Microsoft Office, SharePoint, Teams etc

Description:
The Technology Consulting business within Capability Network invents the future for clients by providing them with the right guidance, design thinking and innovative solutions for technological transformation.
As technology rapidly evolves, it’s more important than ever to have an innovation advisor who can create a new vision or put one into place to solve the client’s toughest business problems.
Specialize in management or technology consulting to transform the world's leading organizations by building innovative business solutions as their trusted advisor by:
Helping Clients: Rethinking IT and Digital ecosystems and innovating to help clients keep pace with fast-changing, customer-driven environments.
Enhancing your Skillset : Building expertise and innovating with leading-edge technologies such as Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence and Cloud.
Transforming Businesses: Developing customized, next-generation products and services that help clients shift to new business models designed for today's connected landscape of disruptive technologies

Working closely with our clients, Consulting professionals design, build and implement strategies that can help enhance business performance. They develop specialized expertise—strategic, industry, functional, technical—in a diverse project environment that offers multiple opportunities for career growth.

The opportunities to make a difference within exciting client initiatives are limitless in this ever-changing business landscape.

Here are just a few of your day-to-day responsibilities.
Identifying, assessing and solving complex business problems for area of responsibility, where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.

Implementing programs/interventions that prepare the organization for implementation of new business processes
Developing our offerings and assets

• Bachelor Degree • MBA Degree from Tier-1 College (Preferable) • Minimum of 4-7 years large scale consulting experience and managing teams in a consulting environment or at high tech companies

Title: Research Engineer - Data Analytics and AI
Description:
Are you passionate about growing your Data Analytics or AI skills? We are looking for an energetic and talented Data Analytics to join our R&D team in Bangalore.

Our Research Group (Advanced Data Management) is part of Business Analytics and Monitoring (BAM) Technology Field of CT Research. Headquartered in Munich, we are a passionate global team of around 220 researchers, data scientists and architects distributed across the globe. We strive to solve complex problems in various domains ranging from mobility, industry, energy, and buildings to smart cities by applying methods and principles of data analytics and artificial intelligence. We are looking for equally passionate techies to join us in this exciting journey of finding innovative solutions to some non-trivial industrial problems.

Here is your role. What part will you play?

Analyze large, complex data sets by developing advanced machine learning and deep learning pipelines based on business initiatives.

You will have the ability to move beyond theoretical models and build innovative, practical and robust real world solutions for problems in traffic management, autonomous building control for energy and comfort optimization, smart robotics for Industry 4.0.

You will demonstrate outstanding ability to drive innovation and research in the form of patents and publishing papers at top-tier conferences/journals.

We don’t need superheroes, just super minds.

PhD/Masters/Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline from a reputed institute with grass-root experience in solving complex problems and driving actionable insights.

Experience in Proven deep technical expertise in designing and programming large scale data driven solutions using any of the high level programming languages viz. Java/Python/C++/Scala

You must have experience in research, development and prototype software technologies related to Object Detection, Tracking, 3D reconstruction, SLAM and Photometric Stereo.

You must have experience in Machine Learning techniques such as Forecasting, Classification, Clustering, Text Mining, Decision Trees, Random Forest and Search algorithms.

You should have experience ranging from 1-2 years in working on image processing and computer vision problems with a clear understanding and ability to implement algorithms (especially deep learning algorithms).

o Hands-on experience using OpenCV and OpenGL

o Optimization techniques for model training and deployment on GPUs

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.
We’re Siemens. A collection of over 379,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality and we welcome applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit and business need. Bring your curiosity and imagination, and help us shape tomorrow.

Find out more about department at: Corporate Research, Siemens India

Title: Vendor Management Lead
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.

Role with us
Manage and effectively lead a group of technical staff to ensure the successful operations of the Mass Market Operations business based within several Industry Partners in India. Achieve agreed customer service delivery and business targets for all associated Fixed wireline and Mobility support functions
This role will be key to enabling the continued evolution of our business model to streamline our Operations in India. You will lead a small but potent team in the ICC that will be accountable for the service delivery performance of our Industry Partners in India for Fixed Wireline and Mobile Activations. You will be accountable for building effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders and the development of the Mass Market operations team in the Innovation Capability Centre as we realign and optimise our service delivery footprint
Key Accountabilities
Guide and support our Industry Partners to achieve SLA performance, customer experience expectations and quality standards within budget.
Oversee performance to Operational KPIs and assist with driving the Industry Partners to achieve key deliverables (see Activation Metrics)
Conduct daily/weekly performance stand-ups with the industry partner leadership teams and act as a conduit between the cross functional teams in Telstra and the partner should there be any escalations
Understand Telstra’s Risk and Compliance Framework (e.g. Privacy risk, Security risk, IT Risk etc.) and support/ facilitate partner in developing suitable Plans to ensure compliance (e.g. Business Continuity Plans)
Ensuring there is no risk to Telstra’s Regulatory obligations – Meet and exceed on the industry regulatory standards [ACMA]
Build highly effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders and the development of the team
Build and maintain solid, productive relationships with industry partners and other operational leads to ensure consistency and improvement across the entire activation episode.
Work with the partners to execute troubleshooting exercises required to ensure order progression, including escalation into dependant groups where required (i.e. Field workforce, Sales, IT)
Identification and resolution of partner pain points, including feedback to the vertical on systemic issues requiring improvement
Monitoring of quality and compliance through presence on the floor – partner with the quality teams to ensure the quality framework meets business needs
Maintain the business area Operating / Engagement Model, updating it as new situations arise
Input into the monthly forecasting process, to ensure the Operational lead has appropriate input to sign off on forecast [i.e. – AHT reviews]
Providing Key Operational input to shape the contractual obligations from a commercial stand point
Ensure effective reporting frameworks are in place to support monitoring of key operational metrics
Co-ordinate post-implementation reviews of projects or plans, and analyse their impact on the achievement of the groups KPIs
Act as the point of contact for any incident management or business continuity events [Downtime due to systems being offline, weather and political events] that severely impact operations
Collaborate with the partner to develop glide paths to recovery based on factual evidence, performance standards and staffing levels and ensure the partner delivers on the stated glide paths
Ensure the partner teams are 100% compliant with all Telstra mandatory training course – i.e. Business Essentials
Accountable for the implementation of new processes & procedures. This may include a small scale, fully operational, implementation of a new process - to learn how to bring the change into complete readiness
Conduct weekly/fortnightly ride-on’s to understand the process gaps and determine improvement opportunities
Develop a 30-60-90-day program of work to improve the partners performance and also undertake analysis, research & diagnosis to identify patterns, trends or issues that need a solution or resolution to be developed
Onsite guidance and support for any future Transition activities. Provide “on-site” health checks for the project team for any transition with the aim of achieving Tollgate on or before plan

Relevant experience in Leading diverse teams
Relevant tertiary qualifications (e.g. business, commercial, management, procurement) coupled with 5 to 10 years demonstrated experience (i.e. considered a specialist in field)

Title: Senior Automation QA Engineer (Remote/Work-from-home)
Description:
WalletHub is one of the leading personal finance destinations in the US and rapidly growing. We’re looking for a motivated, hardworking, and competitive Senior Automation QA Engineer for a full-time, permanent position.
The expected work schedule is 7 AM to 7 PM EST Monday to Friday, including a 1h break.
Responsibilities
Reporting and validating bugs for all components
Creating test plans and test cases
Creating and maintaining automated tests using Selenium and Java
Identifying opportunities for improvement and making constructive suggestions for change
Staying up-to-date with developing technologies and showcasing them in your work
Qualifications
You are the ideal candidate for this job if you have:
At least 3 years of hands-on experience in Test Automation with Java and Selenium
At least 4 years experience in Manual Testing
Excellent attention to details
Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Willingness to work hard
Proficient in written/spoken English
Compensation
Very competitive salary based on prior experience and qualifications
Potential for stock options after the first year
Raise and advancement opportunities based on periodic evaluations
The ability to work overtime for added income
100% remote position
Visa sponsorship (after 24 months with the company, based on performance, in case you will be working from outside the US)
How to apply
To get our attention, all you need to do is apply on Indeed and include your updated resume as well as a brief message telling us why you are the right candidate.If we believe that you will be a good match, we'll contact you to arrange the next steps of the application process.
Please know that we appreciate your interest in our company but due to the high number of applications we are unable to get back to candidates who have not been selected to move forward.
Note
This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed remotely from outside the U.S. without the need for U.S. work authorization.
More about WalletHub
WalletHub is a high-growth fintech company based in Washington, D.C. that is looking for talented, hard-working individuals to help us reshape personal finance. More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:
1) Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.
2) Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.
3) Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.
In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹960,000.00 to ₹2,100,000.00 /year

Title: Small Business NBN Operations Manager
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
Own the delivery of Consumer/Small Business customer activations leading Telstra Operations specialists and Industry Partner staff across multiple offshore functions remotely and on-site.
Manage and effectively lead a group of technical staff to ensure the successful operations of the Consumer/Small Business Activations business based within our Industry Partners in India. Achieve agreed customer service delivery and business targets for associated support functions
Key Service Delivery metrics include;
 Customer satisfaction impacting metrics - episode Net Promoter Score, Cycle Time, Customer Right First Time & TCD
 Service Delivery - manage the quality of the output in order to achieve key operational metrics (e.g. Partial Completes, Reschedules, Re-raises, Complaints, & Call Centric measures such as ASA, Abandon rate & FCR
 Risk management – ensure compliance to all regulatory obligations (ie: ACMA, Priority Assist, etc.)
 Financial - managing performance within budget and to agreed productivity levels
Key Accountabilities
agreed service levels
Identify Operational gaps and patterns, execute troubleshooting exercises across the functional streams to ensure order progression and removal of blockers
Providing Key Operational input to shape the contractual obligations from a commercials stand point – includes input into the monthly forecasting decision
Develop and maintain tracking and reporting frameworks
Identify, discuss and facilitate resolution of all issues, blockers and staff ideas with the industry partner and internal stakeholders to ensure a cycle of improvement, and development of agents is undertaken.
Identify and address any gaps agent skill set or training requirements inhibiting delivery to operational performance metrics
Build and maintain solid, productive relationships with industry partners and other operational leads to ensure consistency and improvement across the entire NBN activation episode.
Engage in ongoing reviews of business and IT processes and systems to ensure appropriate input is provided to the vertical on the segments continuous improvement program of work
Build highly effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders
Maintain the business area Operating / Engagement Model, updating it as new situations arise
Accountable for ensuring the effective implementation and embedding of new processes & procedures on the ground. Liaison back into the Vertical on all change programs to ensure the operational requirements are factored into the change plans
Lead in country situational management to drive partner performance
<Include risk/compliance related obligations>
Facilitate monthly business review for the Consumer/Small Business activation segment, driving collaboration across the Industry Partner and the Service Delivery team and the Activations vertical
Skill & Experience: 8 + yrs
Relevant experience in Leading diverse teams
Relevant tertiary qualifications (e.g. business, commercial, management, procurement) coupled with 5 to 10 years demonstrated experience (i.e. considered a specialist in field)
Experience in driving operational improvement programs across third-party service providers, especially in India.
Experience delivering significant cost savings over the life of Partner contracts
Experience engaging and influencing senior stakeholders, both internal and external, to achieve business objectives
Commercial management experience and contribution to solving complex problems.
Proven ability to contribute to and inform strategy development within area of expertise
Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working in a complex, cross functional company such as Telstra
International BPO Experience
Customer engagement and relationship management
Technical Descriptors
Motivate - Motivates with Vision and Meaning, Empowers and Coaches Others
Accelerate - Accelerates Change, Drives Speed and Agility
Customer engagement
Collaborate - Collaborates to Achieve Outcomes, Develops Inclusive, High Performing Teams
Innovate - Challenges to Simplify and Innovate, Leads Customer Obsession
Stakeholder management
Anticipating change
Improving technology systems, Improving processes
Business partnering
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Internship
Description:
About the company:
Trendzlink Technology is a platform which uses artificial intelligence to build new products in media and education space.
About the internship/job:
Selected intern's day-to-day responsibilities include: 1. Web development using Python 2. Working on machine learning and Android 3. Working on any new project.

are available for full time (in-office) internship
have relevant skills and interests
can start the internship between 4th Jul'19 and 3rd Aug'19

Title: Intership for Artificial Intelligence
Description:
Job Summary
In Artificial Intelligence training course you learn Python, Principles of Machine Learning, Deep learning fundamentals with Keras, Deep learning fundamentals with Pytorch, Reinforcement Learning, Speech Recognition Systems, Natural Language Processing, Neural Network, Azure Machine Learning, Chatbot and Tensorflow.
Responsibilities and Duties
By now, we are quite sure you would have understood the roles and responsibilities of data scientists.Machine Learning (ML) scientists build methods for predicting product suggestions and product demand and explore Big Data to automatically extract patterns. Machine learning and Artificial intelligence are integral parts of data science, where techniques from both such as regression, predictive analytics and more are applied. If you are an AI aspirant, you might want to consider more about becoming a machine learning engineer
Qualifications and Skills
AI is the latest buzzword in Tech. All the major enterprises will make use of AI in the future to improve their productivity. Tech giants like Apple, Google and Facebook have already climbed on the bandwagon of AI. So what are you waiting for? Both Data Science and Machine Learning are generating more jobs making these two areas the fastest growing tech employment areas today.
The demand for AI certified professionals will grow along with the developments in AI. Getting trained in AI will give you an edge over other IT professionals as AI is the future of IT.
Benefits
According to the latest industry estimates, an AI professional with an experience of 2-4 years can earn annually ₹ 15-₹ 20 lakhs ($20.6-27.5K). Experienced professionals with 4-8 years can expect up to ₹ 20-₹ 50 lakhs ($20.6-68.8K).
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹18,000.00 to ₹80,000.00 /month
Experience:
work: 1 year (Preferred)
Education:
Diploma (Required)

Title: Deep Learning R&D Engineer
Description:
Job Description
Responsible for analyzing and optimizing deep learning (DL) and machine learning (ML) models, algorithms and applications on current and next generation Intel hardware and instruction sets.
Design, develop and optimize ML kernels and Algorithms for Deep Learning accelerators.
Profile distributed DL models to identify performance bottlenecks and propose solutions across individual component teams.
Interact with global implementation team and deep learning researchers in defining cutting edge solutions

Qualifications

Mtech/MS in CS, ECE or related fields
Hands-on experience with developing high performance, multi-threaded and distributed software on multi-core CPUs, compute clusters, GPUs and heterogeneous clusters is preferred.
Solid expertise in Distributed Algorithms and High Performance Computing algorithms
Experience in optimizing software systems for CPU/GPUs.
Strong statistics, applied math skills for real world HPC and Deep learning problems
Experience in any Machine learning/ Deep Learning Benchmarking process/tools is a plus.
Experience in Distributed Deep Learning is a big plus
Strong coding skills in C++ and Python is a MUST
Experience with compiler design and graph based optimizations is a plus
Good communication skills
Ability to work in a dynamic, cross-geo, startup-like environment
Inside this Business Group
Intel AI, leveraging Intel's world leading position in silicon innovation and proven history in creating the compute standards that power our world, is transforming Artificial Intelligence (AI) with the Intel AI products portfolio. Harnessing silicon designed specifically for AI, end to end solutions that broadly span from the data center to the edge, and tools that enable customers to quickly deploy and scale up, Intel AI is inside AI and leading the next evolution of compute.

Legal Disclaimer:
Intel prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.
It has come to our notice that some people have received fake job interview letters ostensibly issued by Intel, inviting them to attend interviews in Intel’s offices for various positions and further requiring them to deposit money to be eligible for the interviews. We wish to bring to your notice that these letters are not issued by Intel or any of its authorized representatives. Hiring at Intel is based purely on merit and Intel does not ask or require candidates to deposit any money. We would urge people interested in working for Intel, to apply directly at www.jobs.intel.com and not fall prey to unscrupulous elements.

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Job Location – Pune, India
Required experience – 1-2 Years
About Innoplexus
Innoplexus offers Data as a Service and Continuous Analytics as a Service products, leveraging Artificial Intelligence and advanced analytics to help reduce the drug development time, from synthesis to approval, significantly.
Our products leverage proprietary algorithms and patent-pending technologies to help global Life Sciences and Pharmaceuticals organizations with access to relevant data, real-time intelligence & intuitive insights, across pre-clinical, clinical, regulatory and commercial stages of a drug.
We automate the collection, curation, aggregation, and analysis, of billions of data points from thousands of data sources, using machine learning, network analysis, ontologies, computer vision and entity normalization.
Responsibilities:
Researching scientific data pertaining to a particular topic and finding answers to specific questions based on product/client requirements.
Presenting desired scientific information to other members of the team or clients in a manner that it is easily understood.
Keeping pace with new developments, publications, conferences, activities etc. relevant to the particular scientific field of requirement.
Summarizing research findings and making self-explanatory Excel sheets/PowerPoint presentations for other colleagues of the team.
Regular discussions with other team members towards discussing the progress of current work, finding ways to furnish missing information and working together to meet the company as well as client deadlines in time.
Required experience
1-2 years of experience working in a Pharma based company (desirable)
Strong analytical skills, structured problem solving attitude, excellent written & verbal skills, good knowledge of MS office & other analytical tools for day-to-day use.
An open mind to learn and discover new approaches to achieve a goal.
Required qualification
PhD/Masters in Life sciences.

Title: Consumer and Small Business NBN Delivery Principal
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
To provide strong direction and leadership in the efficiencies and management of the Consumer & Small Business customer activations operational teams. This includes being responsible for the delivery of performance to customer SLAs and execution to the Commercial KPI targets.
To provide indirect leadership to India partner teams and ensure quality of outcomes to agreed set of operational performance metrics while providing a conduit for the partners into the Activations vertical and associated Stakeholder base.
The role will support and contribute to the line of business direction to improve cost and quality, in addition to providing critical input to key operational pain points to feed into the improvement program of work
Key Accountabilities
Lead the operation of the Consumer & Small Business NBN Delivery team
 Point of escalation for issues unable to be resolved through normal escalation processes
 Focus on quality and reducing customer complaints
 Deliver and report services to SLA’s
o Agree satisfactory SLA’s and budget to deliver – with Activation Services journey owners
 Develop and manage the relationship between Telstra business groups in order to deliver to operational objectives
 People leadership and management
o For direct and vendor/partner resources in India
o Create clarity, climate and competence for both Partner staff and Telstra Staff in the portfolio
o Create and build local talent
 On the ground deployment of improvement initiatives to deliver cost and quality benefits
o Identify opportunities to optimise delivery and informing verticals / other horizontals to maintain consistency and share best practice
o Collaborate and deliver on improvement agenda designed by verticals
 HSE Responsibility: Take reasonable care for your own safety and the safety of others, comply with and
 Implement any reasonable Telstra HSE instruction, policy, standard, minimum requirement or procedure, and support Telstra to meet its duties under the relevant safety and environmental legislation.
Skill & Experience 15 + yrs
Operational management and people management of large dispersed and diverse teams (internal and external)
Customer issues management
Track record of collaborating and influencing people
ITIL Certification
Masters of Business Administration
Experience in building operational excellence
BPO
Comfortable with transparency and continuous improvement
Technical Descriptors
Health Safety and Environment (HSE) Leadership
Recovering from setbacks
Business partnering
Implementing strategy
Customer engagement
Resolving customer issues
Driving accountability
Managing sales relationships
Stakeholder management
Improving processes
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Vendor Management Lead
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
Manage and effectively lead a group of technical staff to ensure the successful operations of the Mass Market Operations business based within several Industry Partners in India. Achieve agreed customer service delivery and business targets for all associated Fixed wireline and Mobility support functions
This role will be key to enabling the continued evolution of our business model to streamline our Operations in India. You will lead a small but potent team in the ICC that will be accountable for the service delivery performance of our Industry Partners in India for Fixed Wireline and Mobile Activations. You will be accountable for building effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders and the development of the Mass Market operations team in the Innovation Capability Centre as we realign and optimise our service delivery footprint
Key Accountabilities
Guide and support our Industry Partners to achieve SLA performance, customer experience expectations and quality standards within budget.
Oversee performance to Operational KPIs and assist with driving the Industry Partners to achieve key deliverables (see Activation Metrics)
Conduct daily/weekly performance stand-ups with the industry partner leadership teams and act as a conduit between the cross functional teams in Telstra and the partner should there be any escalations
Understand Telstra’s Risk and Compliance Framework (e.g. Privacy risk, Security risk, IT Risk etc.) and support/ facilitate partner in developing suitable Plans to ensure compliance (e.g. Business Continuity Plans)
Ensuring there is no risk to Telstra’s Regulatory obligations – Meet and exceed on the industry regulatory standards [ACMA]
Build highly effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders and the development of the team
Build and maintain solid, productive relationships with industry partners and other operational leads to ensure consistency and improvement across the entire activation episode.
Work with the partners to execute troubleshooting exercises required to ensure order progression, including escalation into dependant groups where required (i.e. Field workforce, Sales, IT)
Identification and resolution of partner pain points, including feedback to the vertical on systemic issues requiring improvement
Monitoring of quality and compliance through presence on the floor – partner with the quality teams to ensure the quality framework meets business needs
Maintain the business area Operating / Engagement Model, updating it as new situations arise
Input into the monthly forecasting process, to ensure the Operational lead has appropriate input to sign off on forecast [i.e. – AHT reviews]
Providing Key Operational input to shape the contractual obligations from a commercial stand point
Ensure effective reporting frameworks are in place to support monitoring of key operational metrics
Co-ordinate post-implementation reviews of projects or plans, and analyse their impact on the achievement of the groups KPIs
Act as the point of contact for any incident management or business continuity events [Downtime due to systems being offline, weather and political events] that severely impact operations
Collaborate with the partner to develop glide paths to recovery based on factual evidence, performance standards and staffing levels and ensure the partner delivers on the stated glide paths
Ensure the partner teams are 100% compliant with all Telstra mandatory training course – i.e. Business Essentials
Accountable for the implementation of new processes & procedures. This may include a small scale, fully operational, implementation of a new process - to learn how to bring the change into complete readiness
Conduct weekly/fortnightly ride-on’s to understand the process gaps and determine improvement opportunities
Develop a 30-60-90-day program of work to improve the partners performance and also undertake analysis, research & diagnosis to identify patterns, trends or issues that need a solution or resolution to be developed
Onsite guidance and support for any future Transition activities. Provide “on-site” health checks for the project team for any transition with the aim of achieving Tollgate on or before plan
Skill & Experience: 8 + yrs
Relevant experience in Leading diverse teams
Relevant tertiary qualifications (e.g. business, commercial, management, procurement) coupled with 5 to 10 years demonstrated experience (i.e. considered a specialist in field)
Experience in driving operational improvement programs across third-party service providers, especially in India.
Experience delivering significant cost savings over the life of Partner contracts
Experience engaging and influencing senior stakeholders, both internal and external, to achieve business objectives
Commercial management experience and contribution to solving complex problems.
Proven ability to contribute to and inform strategy development within area of expertise
Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working in a complex, cross functional company such as Telstra
International BPO Experience

Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Web API Developer
Description:
Job Summary
With Agenty.com we're building a fully modern user interface for machine learning with hundreds of different types of automotive agents to automate the data collection, processing, validation, translation, cleaning, and the integration with client applications. Agenty is used by customers in retail, healthcare, machine learning, artificial intelligence and many more industries to bring web data to their business. You'll own building this interface in a customer-centric manner, working directly with founding team and global customers to design and implement features throughout the stack.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR :
- Experience in .Net web API development (MVC, Asp.net and C#)
- Hands on experience building end to end systems
- Experience in writing SQL queries in frameworks like Dapper
- Good knowledge of NoSQL databases like MongoDB, CosmoDB
- Good knowledge of code benchmarking, and unit test in Visual Studio
- Knowledge of AWS Cloud or Microsoft Azure is a plus
Responsibilities and Duties
- Build customer facing web API and integration for global customers in C#, Asp. Net web API & SQL.
- Bug fixes, new feature development.
- Technical documentation, video tutorials and presentations.
- Technical support to solve customers queries
Required Experience, Skills and Qualifications
Asp.net, Web API, C#, SQL Server
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹264,000.00 to ₹300,000.00 /year
Experience:
Asp.Net: 1 year (Required)
work: 1 year (Required)
Education:
Bachelor's (Required)
Location:
Gurgaon, Haryana (Required)

Title: Senior Automation QA Engineer (Remote/Work-from-home)
Description:
WalletHub is one of the leading personal finance destinations in the US and rapidly growing. We’re looking for a motivated, hardworking, and competitive Senior Automation QA Engineer for a full-time, permanent position.
The expected work schedule is 7 AM to 7 PM EST Monday to Friday, including a 1h break.
Responsibilities
Reporting and validating bugs for all components
Creating test plans and test cases
Creating and maintaining automated tests using Selenium and Java
Identifying opportunities for improvement and making constructive suggestions for change
Staying up-to-date with developing technologies and showcasing them in your work
Qualifications
You are the ideal candidate for this job if you have:
At least 3 years of hands-on experience in Test Automation with Java and Selenium
At least 4 years experience in Manual Testing
Excellent attention to details
Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Willingness to work hard
Proficient in written/spoken English
Compensation
Very competitive salary based on prior experience and qualifications
Potential for stock options after the first year
Raise and advancement opportunities based on periodic evaluations
The ability to work overtime for added income
100% remote position
Visa sponsorship (after 24 months with the company, based on performance, in case you will be working from outside the US)
How to apply
To get our attention, all you need to do is apply on Indeed and include your updated resume as well as a brief message telling us why you are the right candidate.If we believe that you will be a good match, we'll contact you to arrange the next steps of the application process.
Please know that we appreciate your interest in our company but due to the high number of applications we are unable to get back to candidates who have not been selected to move forward.
Note
This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed remotely from outside the U.S. without the need for U.S. work authorization.
More about WalletHub
WalletHub is a high-growth fintech company based in Washington, D.C. that is looking for talented, hard-working individuals to help us reshape personal finance. More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:
1) Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.
2) Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.
3) Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.
In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹960,000.00 to ₹2,100,000.00 /year

Title: Small Business NBN Operations Manager
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
Own the delivery of Consumer/Small Business customer activations leading Telstra Operations specialists and Industry Partner staff across multiple offshore functions remotely and on-site.
Manage and effectively lead a group of technical staff to ensure the successful operations of the Consumer/Small Business Activations business based within our Industry Partners in India. Achieve agreed customer service delivery and business targets for associated support functions
Key Service Delivery metrics include;
 Customer satisfaction impacting metrics - episode Net Promoter Score, Cycle Time, Customer Right First Time & TCD
 Service Delivery - manage the quality of the output in order to achieve key operational metrics (e.g. Partial Completes, Reschedules, Re-raises, Complaints, & Call Centric measures such as ASA, Abandon rate & FCR
 Risk management – ensure compliance to all regulatory obligations (ie: ACMA, Priority Assist, etc.)
 Financial - managing performance within budget and to agreed productivity levels
Key Accountabilities
agreed service levels
Identify Operational gaps and patterns, execute troubleshooting exercises across the functional streams to ensure order progression and removal of blockers
Providing Key Operational input to shape the contractual obligations from a commercials stand point – includes input into the monthly forecasting decision
Develop and maintain tracking and reporting frameworks
Identify, discuss and facilitate resolution of all issues, blockers and staff ideas with the industry partner and internal stakeholders to ensure a cycle of improvement, and development of agents is undertaken.
Identify and address any gaps agent skill set or training requirements inhibiting delivery to operational performance metrics
Build and maintain solid, productive relationships with industry partners and other operational leads to ensure consistency and improvement across the entire NBN activation episode.
Engage in ongoing reviews of business and IT processes and systems to ensure appropriate input is provided to the vertical on the segments continuous improvement program of work
Build highly effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders
Maintain the business area Operating / Engagement Model, updating it as new situations arise
Accountable for ensuring the effective implementation and embedding of new processes & procedures on the ground. Liaison back into the Vertical on all change programs to ensure the operational requirements are factored into the change plans
Lead in country situational management to drive partner performance
<Include risk/compliance related obligations>
Facilitate monthly business review for the Consumer/Small Business activation segment, driving collaboration across the Industry Partner and the Service Delivery team and the Activations vertical
Skill & Experience: 8 + yrs
Relevant experience in Leading diverse teams
Relevant tertiary qualifications (e.g. business, commercial, management, procurement) coupled with 5 to 10 years demonstrated experience (i.e. considered a specialist in field)
Experience in driving operational improvement programs across third-party service providers, especially in India.
Experience delivering significant cost savings over the life of Partner contracts
Experience engaging and influencing senior stakeholders, both internal and external, to achieve business objectives
Commercial management experience and contribution to solving complex problems.
Proven ability to contribute to and inform strategy development within area of expertise
Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working in a complex, cross functional company such as Telstra
International BPO Experience
Customer engagement and relationship management
Technical Descriptors
Motivate - Motivates with Vision and Meaning, Empowers and Coaches Others
Accelerate - Accelerates Change, Drives Speed and Agility
Customer engagement
Collaborate - Collaborates to Achieve Outcomes, Develops Inclusive, High Performing Teams
Innovate - Challenges to Simplify and Innovate, Leads Customer Obsession
Stakeholder management
Anticipating change
Improving technology systems, Improving processes
Business partnering
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.

Company Description
Shell began operations in India more than 80 years ago. At Shell India, we invest in our people through our industry-leading development programme, which sees our employees thrive and gain access to experts on a local and global level. To date, we have invested more than US$ 1 billion already in India’s energy sector alone in socially and environmentally responsible ways. It is the only global major to have a fuel retail license in India. The Shell Technology Centre Bangalore, STCB, is one of the three global hubs for technology in the Projects & Technology business of Royal Dutch Shell. In addition, we supply crude, chemicals and technology to public and private sector oil companies, and our Chennai Business Centre provides a wide range of finance, accounting and business services to Shell globally.
