Title: Change-Senior Specialist
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future
The Telstra SECs are located across India in various partner locations. These centers operate in hybrid mode along with the partner resources.
This role is for supporting the Enterprise business program running across the centers. This position will work closely with the Technology leads, Stream Manager, Partners, Business units, internal Telstra departments (SEC leads), and will be integral in moving business unit strategy forward.
Responsibilities:
Coordinate with Agile coach, Scrum Master and Tech Leads in identifying wins, messages and stories to be communicated with the teams in parallel to the engineering communications that the team would have with their leads.
Interact with the teams in SEC to bring people together, so we can build cohesive Telstra culture, spread the positiveness and motivating the team to take the lead in driving efficiency.
Interact with the teams to understand the user experience, bring out the positivity and share their story.
Bring together the comms across the geography and help the teams understand the big picture and reemphasize the purpose and the role that the team plays in the transformation journey.
Act as a stimulant in bringing about the enterprise wide change and help with smooth transition by projecting the benefits.
Assist the Engineering leads to document and support inter group presentation. There are often details asked in different formats, and it will help if those details can be shared in the format asked for.
Assist the engineering leads in managing the Metrics - Manage all aspects Engineering Metrics, KPI, capacity planning of SECs, create and generate periodic reports for various business and use case in India.
Work closely with the Digital Transformation in sharing the key achievements, important milestones and employee engagement activities from centers in India. This role will also help collate important communication from across all streams and ensure it reaches the teams in India.
Ensure the proper procedures/documentations are in place. Act as first line of escalation and arrange necessary support as and when clarification is required on local policies, procedures.
Documentation - Serve as the central point of contact for managing all requests for SEC requirements, contracts, exceptions, deficiencies and all the evidentiary documentation that goes along with it in the team’s SharePoint site.
Track timelines as needed for various initiatives within B2B and maintain trackers.
Work with the Engineering leads and the project coordinators to run employee engagement activities and Enterprise stream specific R&R.
Work closely with partner project manager and with ODC feature team leads to ensure smooth Joiner – Leaver process (on boarding of employees), asset management, timely submission of timesheet, completion of mandatory trainings, etc.

Skills Required :
Minimum 8 years professional work experience
3 - 4 years in Enterprise communication, brand building, Organizational Change Management and People engagement activities
3 - 4 years of Project Management experience in Agile (matrix) organizations preferably in a PM/PMO role
Excellent Communication and coordination skill
Strong program management, time management, conflict management, multi-tasking & analytical skills with Agile Scrum and IT infrastructure background.
Discreet and professional with good organizational skills
Articulate, express the thoughts in visual and vocabulary and Extreme attention to detail
Ability to remain calm under pressure
Familiar with Microsoft Office, SharePoint, Teams etc
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit our Telstra Careers Website: tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Web API Developer
Description:
Job Summary
With Agenty.com we're building a fully modern user interface for machine learning with hundreds of different types of automotive agents to automate the data collection, processing, validation, translation, cleaning, and the integration with client applications. Agenty is used by customers in retail, healthcare, machine learning, artificial intelligence and many more industries to bring web data to their business. You'll own building this interface in a customer-centric manner, working directly with founding team and global customers to design and implement features throughout the stack.

- Experience in .Net web API development (MVC, Asp.net and C#)
- Hands on experience building end to end systems
- Experience in writing SQL queries in frameworks like Dapper
- Good knowledge of NoSQL databases like MongoDB, CosmoDB

- Knowledge of AWS Cloud or Microsoft Azure is a plus

- Bug fixes, new feature development.
- Technical documentation, video tutorials and presentations.
- Technical support to solve customers queries

Asp.net, Web API, C#, SQL Server

work: 1 year (Required)

Title: Vendor Management Lead
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
Manage and effectively lead a group of technical staff to ensure the successful operations of the Mass Market Operations business based within several Industry Partners in India. Achieve agreed customer service delivery and business targets for all associated Fixed wireline and Mobility support functions
This role will be key to enabling the continued evolution of our business model to streamline our Operations in India. You will lead a small but potent team in the ICC that will be accountable for the service delivery performance of our Industry Partners in India for Fixed Wireline and Mobile Activations. You will be accountable for building effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders and the development of the Mass Market operations team in the Innovation Capability Centre as we realign and optimise our service delivery footprint
Key Accountabilities
Guide and support our Industry Partners to achieve SLA performance, customer experience expectations and quality standards within budget.
Oversee performance to Operational KPIs and assist with driving the Industry Partners to achieve key deliverables (see Activation Metrics)
Conduct daily/weekly performance stand-ups with the industry partner leadership teams and act as a conduit between the cross functional teams in Telstra and the partner should there be any escalations
Understand Telstra’s Risk and Compliance Framework (e.g. Privacy risk, Security risk, IT Risk etc.) and support/ facilitate partner in developing suitable Plans to ensure compliance (e.g. Business Continuity Plans)
Ensuring there is no risk to Telstra’s Regulatory obligations – Meet and exceed on the industry regulatory standards [ACMA]
Build highly effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders and the development of the team
Build and maintain solid, productive relationships with industry partners and other operational leads to ensure consistency and improvement across the entire activation episode.
Work with the partners to execute troubleshooting exercises required to ensure order progression, including escalation into dependant groups where required (i.e. Field workforce, Sales, IT)
Identification and resolution of partner pain points, including feedback to the vertical on systemic issues requiring improvement
Monitoring of quality and compliance through presence on the floor – partner with the quality teams to ensure the quality framework meets business needs
Maintain the business area Operating / Engagement Model, updating it as new situations arise
Input into the monthly forecasting process, to ensure the Operational lead has appropriate input to sign off on forecast [i.e. – AHT reviews]
Providing Key Operational input to shape the contractual obligations from a commercial stand point
Ensure effective reporting frameworks are in place to support monitoring of key operational metrics
Co-ordinate post-implementation reviews of projects or plans, and analyse their impact on the achievement of the groups KPIs
Act as the point of contact for any incident management or business continuity events [Downtime due to systems being offline, weather and political events] that severely impact operations
Collaborate with the partner to develop glide paths to recovery based on factual evidence, performance standards and staffing levels and ensure the partner delivers on the stated glide paths
Ensure the partner teams are 100% compliant with all Telstra mandatory training course – i.e. Business Essentials
Accountable for the implementation of new processes & procedures. This may include a small scale, fully operational, implementation of a new process - to learn how to bring the change into complete readiness
Conduct weekly/fortnightly ride-on’s to understand the process gaps and determine improvement opportunities
Develop a 30-60-90-day program of work to improve the partners performance and also undertake analysis, research & diagnosis to identify patterns, trends or issues that need a solution or resolution to be developed
Onsite guidance and support for any future Transition activities. Provide “on-site” health checks for the project team for any transition with the aim of achieving Tollgate on or before plan
Skill & Experience: 8 + yrs
Relevant experience in Leading diverse teams
Relevant tertiary qualifications (e.g. business, commercial, management, procurement) coupled with 5 to 10 years demonstrated experience (i.e. considered a specialist in field)
Experience in driving operational improvement programs across third-party service providers, especially in India.
Experience delivering significant cost savings over the life of Partner contracts
Experience engaging and influencing senior stakeholders, both internal and external, to achieve business objectives
Commercial management experience and contribution to solving complex problems.
Proven ability to contribute to and inform strategy development within area of expertise
Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working in a complex, cross functional company such as Telstra
International BPO Experience

Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.

Title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Internship
Description:
About the company:
Cynapto is a young technology company with a deep sense of accountability and social responsibility, placing equal emphasis on products/projects in the for-profit and social sectors. Our mission is to connect our clients with their audiences in the most direct and engaging way possible: through the devices that people keep with them at all times.
About the internship/job:
Selected intern's day-to-day responsibilities include: 1. Work on the company's AI products, mainly dealing with Image Processing (Using Computer Vision, Deep Learning) 2. Work on development using Python, CV, Numpy, Tensorflow, etc. 3. Handle web services & build software products
Who can apply:
Only those students or freshers can apply who:
are available for full time (in-office) internship
have relevant skills and interests
can start the internship between 29th Jun'19 and 29th Jul'19
are available for duration of 6 months
have already graduated or are currently in any year of study
Females willing to start/restart their career may also apply
Number of internships/jobs available: 1
Categories: Artificial Intelligence (AI),Computer Science,Engineering

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to help us create artificial intelligence products. Machine Learning Engineer responsibilities include creating machine learning models and retraining systems. To do this job successfully, you need exceptional skills in statistics and programming. If you also have knowledge of data science and software engineering, we'd like to meet you. Your ultimate goal will be to shape and build efficient self-learning applications.


Responsibilities:
Designing and developing machine learning and deep learning systems.
Running machine learning tests and experiments.
Implementing appropriate ML algorithms.
Study and transform data science prototypes.
Design machine learning systems.
Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools.
Develop machine learning applications according to requirements.
Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods.
Run machine learning tests and experiments.
Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results.
Train and retrain systems when necessary.
Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks.
Keep abreast of developments in the field.


Requirements:
Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role.
Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture.
Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms.
Ability to write robust code in Python, Java and R.
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn).
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to work in a team.
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills.
BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Master's degree is a plus.

Title: Trainer / Subject expert
Description:
Trainers Required In each of the following fields : Internet Of things ,Artificial Intelligence ,Machine Learning ,Embedded Electronics and robotics ,Digital Marketing ,Data Analytics ,Databases ,Python/Java ,Tech Interview Preparation,Flutter,React native.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Salary: ₹5,000.00 to ₹30,000.00 /month

Description:

Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.

agreed service levels

Title: Artificial Intelligence Pillar Leader-Technology Centre
Description:
Role Summary: Lead cross GE India Technology initiative to drive multi-business effort on Artificial Intelligence by creating multi-business projects to solve some of the toughest Digital-Industrial problems with Artificial Intelligence technologies. Drive development of next generation Artificial Intelligence technology that will differentiate GE’s products and services through this effort and create a multiplicative impact on GE.
Essential Responsibilities: As the Pillar Leader for Artificial Intelligence you will:
Work with business leaders to identify top problems that can be solved through Artificial Intelligence, machine learning, data science and physical-digital technologies.
Drive execution of technologies in AI to solve the top problems and deliver value to GE Businesses.
Guide, mentor and coach the team members and develop the next generation AI leaders for the company.
Create open work environment and sharing of technology across business and disciplines by bringing in physics and domain knowledge together with machine learning and AI.
Establish a strategy for reusable capabilities in AI, so others in the company can use this capability to accelerate value delivery.
Drive execution of the portfolio of technology development in alignment with business needs. Drive Fastworks culture in the team and drive agility in execution.
Ensure strategic intellectual property protection and freedom to operate for key technologies and products
Qualifications/Requirements: •Master’s Degree in Computer Science or any relevant engineering degree with at least 10 years hands on experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies.
Demonstrated impact, leadership capability and ability to lead, build and energize cross-functional teams in Artificial Intelligence technologies including but not limited to artificial intelligence, text mining, voice application, sensing technologies, prognostics, predictive analytics, domain-based signal processing, physics-based modeling for real-time applications.
Demonstrated ability to understand customer needs and industry trends; simplify strategy into specific actions, make decisions and communicate priorities. Strong industry knowledge in Power, Transportation or Healthcare segments.
Desired Characteristics: PhD Degree in Computer Science and any engineering degree with at least 15 years hands on experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies.
Prior experience leading projects and people in a problem solving setting. Thrives in a matrix environment
Ability to work effectively across functions and demonstrated ability to coach and mentor others
Strong communication skills including the ability to clearly communicate technical strategies
Demonstrated ability to influence without formal authority and collaboration across teams
Demonstrated operational rigor. Ability to make decisions with confidence when problems or solutions are not 100% defined. Influence, facilitation, and negotiation skills; boundary-less/solution-focused approach
Proven ability to manage risk and uncertainty for self and team within a dynamic priority-setting environment
About Us: GE (NYSE: GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for our customers. www.ge.com Additional Locations: India;Bengaluru;

Title: Graduate Intern
Description:
Job Description
Responsibilities may be quite diverse and are exempt nontechnical in nature. U.S. experience and education requirements will vary significantly depending on the unique needs of the job. Job assignments are usually for the summer or for short time periods during breaks from school.

Qualifications
M Tech
Inside this Business Group
The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

Legal Disclaimer:
Intel prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.
It has come to our notice that some people have received fake job interview letters ostensibly issued by Intel, inviting them to attend interviews in Intel’s offices for various positions and further requiring them to deposit money to be eligible for the interviews. We wish to bring to your notice that these letters are not issued by Intel or any of its authorized representatives. Hiring at Intel is based purely on merit and Intel does not ask or require candidates to deposit any money. We would urge people interested in working for Intel, to apply directly at www.jobs.intel.com and not fall prey to unscrupulous elements.

Title: Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
The AI R&D team is part of Data Sc. R&D. The AI R&D team is created to carry on world class R&D in AI, machine vision, NLP, knowledge graphs etc.. Apart from R&D, this team will devote half of their efforts to develop AI based products for Shell.

The machine learning specialist is be responsible for R&D and product development around AI. Machine learning specialist will report the Team Lead - Artificial Intelligence.

Research & Development
drive specific R&D activities and contribute to the overall AI R&D program.
Quickly develop proof of concepts to validate new methods
Remain up to date on different R&D activities in AI around the world.
Manage one external relation
Product Development
Support as core AI specialist in more than one project
Play the key role in identifying the tool stack for development

Title: Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
Are you a bright & passionate Machine Learning Specialist looking for an opportunity to advance your career?
If you are a team player who strives for engineering and technical excellence and enjoys in bringing innovation in a fast paced environment, we have a perfect job for you!
We are looking for a Machine Learning Specialist to join our dream team!
We offer excellent development prospects, the ability to develop your skills to the highest level and be compensated with a competitive salary.
You will lead all the processes from data collection, cleaning, and preprocessing, to training models and deploying them to production.
The ideal candidate will be passionate about artificial intelligence and stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the field.
Machine Learning Specialist duties and responsibilities
Research, design, and implement machine learning applications.
Ensure that machine learning applications are available to product.
Keep up-to-date with new technologies that may be able to support machine learning applications.
Aid product development teams in coming up with new ideas for machine learning applications.
Understand the necessary data requirements to implement machine learning applications.
Able to prototype machine learning applications and quickly determine application viability.
Prepare and analyze historical data and identify patterns
Provide technical support for program management and business development activities including proposal writing and customer development
Own and manage knowledge sharing within a community

REQUIREMENTS
Academic degree – examples:
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, statistics or related quantitative discipline with a focus on Machine Learning/AI/Reinforcement learning or related areas with at least 3 years of experience
Strong quantitative background: A degree in Computer Science, Computational Linguistics, Physics, Mathematics or related field.
A B.S./M.S./Ph.D. degree in Computer Science or related engineering fields.
Other requirements
Solid engineering and coding skills, with the ability to write high-performance production quality code
Proficiency in Python as well as the numerical libraries such as Scikit-Learn, Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy.
Experience in deep learning frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, Keras) and open-source NLP toolkits like NLTK or TextBlob
Experience with Elasticsearch
Strong background in natural language processing, statistical modelling, and/or machine learning
Experience working on a range of ML problems, particularly NLP, Industry or academic
2+ years’ experience in development and delivery of real-world products or services, building and productionising innovative end-to-end Machine Learning systems
Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas to other members of the team.
WHAT WE’RE WORKING ON
Recommendation and Personalisation
Natural Language Processing and Query Understanding
Deep Learning
Text Understanding
ABOUT YOU
You have the ability to quickly prototype ideas and solve complex problems by adopting creative approaches
You are a strong collaborator and communicator and you make the engineers around you grow and learn.
You love building robust and generalisable models
You take pride in the things you build
You can demonstrate a track record of trying and learning new things
You have a point of view but are low ego
You have excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills
Summary of skills
CS fundamentals and programming
Probability and statistics
Data modelling and evaluation
Applying ML algorithms and libraries
Software engineering and system design

Title: Business Operations Specialist
Description:
Responsibilities:
Workflow Design: Build and manage multiple client outreach campaigns for US clients, on our platform.
Analytical Decision Making: End to end Metrics tracking for all projects as well all metrics of the system.
Support Customer Success: Liaise between the client's operations team and internal team to deliver SLAs.
Hire & Manage Supply: Hire, train and manage contractors (remote worker-partners) in the US > Squad is a Future of Work' software company that combines a distributed workforce (think Uber for Work') and artificial intelligence in one powerful platform to help you scale your business with better conversions, speed, accuracy, flexibility, and cost.
Reporting: Build customer-client reports and present findings on a regular basis.


Requirements:
1-2 years of relevant work experience in operations or customer success.
Strong quantitative and analytical skills - strong working experience of Microsoft Excel.
Proficient critical thinking, problem-solving, decision making and leadership capabilities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to build and/or modify scripts/emails for client outreach campaigns.
Must have experience of handling foreign (preferably US based) customer (relevant experience in US tele-calling BPO is a plus).
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and planning.
Engineering background is a plus.

Accountable for ensuring the effective implementation and embedding of new processes & procedures on the ground. Liaison back into the Vertical on all change programs to ensure the operational requirements are factored into the change plans
Lead in country situational management to drive partner performance
<Include risk/compliance related obligations>
Facilitate monthly business review for the Consumer/Small Business activation segment, driving collaboration across the Industry Partner and the Service Delivery team and the Activations vertical
Skill & Experience: 8 + yrs
Relevant experience in Leading diverse teams
Relevant tertiary qualifications (e.g. business, commercial, management, procurement) coupled with 5 to 10 years demonstrated experience (i.e. considered a specialist in field)
Experience in driving operational improvement programs across third-party service providers, especially in India.
Experience delivering significant cost savings over the life of Partner contracts
Experience engaging and influencing senior stakeholders, both internal and external, to achieve business objectives
Commercial management experience and contribution to solving complex problems.
Proven ability to contribute to and inform strategy development within area of expertise
Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working in a complex, cross functional company such as Telstra
International BPO Experience
Customer engagement and relationship management
Technical Descriptors
Motivate - Motivates with Vision and Meaning, Empowers and Coaches Others
Accelerate - Accelerates Change, Drives Speed and Agility
Customer engagement
Collaborate - Collaborates to Achieve Outcomes, Develops Inclusive, High Performing Teams
Innovate - Challenges to Simplify and Innovate, Leads Customer Obsession
Stakeholder management
Anticipating change
Improving technology systems, Improving processes
Business partnering
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

With Agenty.com we're building a fully modern user interface for machine learning with hundreds of different types of automotive agents to automate the data collection, processing, validation, translation, cleaning, and the integration with client applications. Agenty is used by customers in retail, healthcare, machine learning, artificial intelligence and many more industries to bring web data to their business. Title: Java Full Stack Developer / Core Java / HTML / Java Script /...
Description:
Requisition ID: 218026
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
JOB TITLE: Developer - Cloud HCM Analytics Team
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES:
At SAP SuccessFactors we have started a Human Revolution. Using the latest technology, we are unlocking human potential and transforming our customer’s workforces in ways they never imagined. We are digitally transforming their businesses into the next generation of intelligent enterprises. Because people are at the heart of every business transformation and people are the heart of our business. The SAP SuccessFactors product suite spans core human resources and payroll, analytics-based hiring and customized onboarding, continuous performance management, intelligent succession and more. We operate the largest HCM Cloud in the world, supporting over 120 million users with over a billion transactions for customers across 26 industries in over 90 countries. Our co-located agile teams have end-to-end ownership of product, design, development, release, user assistance, and cloud operations capabilities. We are looking for the best talent to join our team and deliver continuous innovations in the cloud while bringing purpose to their lives and more meaning to their work. Join us today and become a part of the Human Revolution.
ABOUT THE TEAM
The Cloud HCM Analytics team builds the analytics solution on top of world’s biggest cloud-based enterprise application which has unique challenge in building a common solution that should be customizable for more than 4,450 across 60 industries in over 177 countries and scalable for 50 million users usage. We are responsible for building operational reporting solutions, as well as cutting edge analytical solutions. This team provides ample opportunities to interact with various stake holders and come of the best solution and implement the same with support for highly customizable and scalable approach. Current development activities involved in make use of Predictive Analytics, Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence. We have ambitious road map to start working on Prescriptive analytics.
Position Overview
Developers should be able to work as a Full stack developer with specialized either in UI or back end. Design highly scalable and performant solution which address functional as well as nonfunctional requirement with high quality.
Full stack developer – willing and capable of handling both client and server development
End to end responsibility – take care of your feature from requirements to deployment
Collaborate well – demonstrate excellent development practices, share and motivate others.
This development role provides immense potential for growth. The potential candidate would work closely with other members of the team and other functional groups within SAP SuccessFactors
SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Strong technical skills with technologies like Java/J2EE, Hibernate, Spring, SAP HANA, UI Technologies and OData protocols to develop modem cutting edge software that performs and scales in cloud environment
Server oriented - Knowledge in Java backend development (tomcat, JEE, dependency injection, and more) – mandatory
At least basic client-side knowledge of Web technologies, JS, HTML, CSS – mandatory.
Sound knowledge in Object Oriented Programming Principles, Design Patterns and Software Architecture, especially in new age Cloud solutions
Must be able to design and implement across all layers of the software (UI, Backend, Database)
Exposure to debugging, troubleshooting and performance tuning for complex SQL queries
Knowledge of lean development infrastructure process including Git, TeamCity, Jenkins etc. and exposure to Continuous Delivery practices
Exposure to building Analytical and report modelling for highly customizable Enterprise cloud-based SaaS application
Working knowledge of Scrum, Test Driven Development and passionate about unit test, integrity testing, stress testing and performance testing and test automation
Exposure to building large scale application deployed on public cloud like AWS, AZURE etc ..
EDUCATION, WORK EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS
BE/B.Tech, ME/M.Tech, MCA with 60% aggregate across.
Strong educational qualifications (Engineering majors, MCA from reputed institutes)
4-8 years of professional experience in developing Java/J2EE based enterprise web-based application,
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Bachelor’s in Computer Science required, Master preferred.
#SAPSFSF

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
Additional Locations:

Title: Software-Senior Engineer(CPQ Architect)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
CPQ Technical Architect is responsible for leading technical CPQ low level architecture activities for Telstra across requirement analysis, design, development and implementation on Telstra’s key CRM platforms. They will be responsible for developing and coordinating technical delivery aspects of all Telstra’s CRM systems implementations, communicating effectively and fostering strong relationships with business users and stakeholders.
The purpose of the role is to take responsibility for ensuring all requests from the business are developed and delivered in the most optimal way taking into consideration business roadmaps, ITS CRM Strategy, industry best practice, vendor roadmaps and thought leadership and innovation delivering a competitive advantage to Telstra.
He will participate in and/or be responsible for technical analysis of functional designs, preparation of technical designs, technical build & implementation of CRM, CRM configuration and scripting, quality & code reviews, facilitating testing, resolution of defects identified during test, managing relationships between support and development team, mentoring and training
Key Accountabilities
Salesforce Technical Architect role is to plan, coordinate, and execute all activities related to the requirements interpretation, design and implementation of CPQ, CLM applications. This individual will apply proven industry and technology experience as well as communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to issues related to design, development, and deployment of mission-critical CRM systems with a focus on quality application development and delivery.
This role is key to the success of the Customer Platforms function at Telstra and will be responsible and accountable for the following:
Ability to design and develop Salesforce CRM, Cloudsense CPQ & Force.com Applications
Ability to review vendor designs and recommended solutions based on industry best practises
Ability to provide technical governance across Cloudsense CPQ solutions at Telstra
Assess and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the Salesforce application solutions to ensure user requirements and business objectives are met in a timely and cost effective manner
Understand overall business operations and develops innovative solutions to help improve productivity
Ability to understand and design provisioning solutions at Telstra and how CRM interacts with provisioning layers.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills needed to support enterprise high availability Salesforce applications
Coordinate with technical resource within and outside of Customer Platforms team.
Monitor process of software configuration/development/testing to assure quality deliverable.
Ensure standards of QA are being met
Review deliverables to verify that they meet client and contract expectations; Implement and enforce high standards for quality deliverables
Analyses performance and capacity issues of the highest complexity with Salesforce application.
Demonstrate thought Leadership in Cloudsense CPQ innovations and practices.
Assists leadership with development and management of new application capabilities to improve productivity
Provide training and educate other team members around core capabilities and helps them deliver high quality solutions and deliverables/documentation
Self-Motivator to perform Design / Develop user requirements, test and deploy the changes into production
Skill & Experience : 12 + yrs
SFDC, APEX, Conga, Appttus, Cloudsense
Technical Descriptors
Salesforce – Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Force. Com platform
Salesforce Certified Developer / Advanced Developer / Technical Architect is essential
Experience in building applications on force.com platform with extensive hands-on and subject matter expertise in Salesforce technology including
Full cycle implementation experience with SFDC (application design, architecture and development using Salesforce.com)
Strong SFDC knowledge and Integration components for SFDC (SFDC APIs, Apex controllers, Apex Web Services, Apex callout, outbound messaging, SFDC data loaders, etc.)
Command over APEX and Visual force
Hands on experience in building salesforce apex classes, test classes and deployment process.
Deep knowledge of Salesforce API’s and hands on experience in building custom API’s and integration.
Working knowledge of web frameworks – HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JSON, Ajax
working knowledge of all Atlassian tools a bonus
Expertise in developing CPQ capability using Cloudsense.
Proven experience of working with Telco Clients to configure products, Baskets, Order Orchestration and Technical Enrichment.
Certifications in Appttus and Conga would be essential.
Expertise in developing Contract management solution integrating into CPQ using Conga or Appttus
Proven experience with creation of relevant documentation including, but not limited to Apttus CPQ solution design document and requirements documentation
Experience with migration of CPQ across environments including experience with the Apttus migration tool
Knowledge of the fundamental capabilities of Apttus CPQ including but not limited to:
Quoting and Quote Templates
Approvals (Deal Manager/IWA preferred)
X- Author
Fundamental understanding of Apttus CLM capabilities, Apttus CLM 201 certification a plus
Experience with Apttus Advanced Workflow Approvals
Experience with X-Author for Excel and Contracts
Experience with Apttus Wizard
Familiar with Apttus admin settings, Apttus custom settings and DocuSign settings.
Knowledge of Apttus development
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Software-Senior Engineer(DEVOPS Product owner)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us:
To create a brilliant connected future for everybody through the delivery of high quality software solutions.
Technical Product owner is responsible for laying out vision for implementing DEVOPS i..e CI/CD, Automation Testing, TDD, Monitoring across SaaS and IaaS platforms on AWS and Azure
Key Accountabilities:
Technical Product Owner would be responsible for laying out the vision and blueprints and bring it to reality with a DevSecOps view.
Identify industry best practices and standards for implementation of Cloud.
Guide engineers and developers in following best practices and standards and cross train them on cloud technology.
Complying with all relevant processes and standards, including change management principles and processes to ensure deliverables meet or exceed defined quality standards.
Skill & Experience: 12 + yrs Exp
DEVOPS, CI/CD, Agile, Bamboo, Jenkins, AWS, Azzure, Git, Bitbucket, Docker, Virtualisation, Monitoring, Teraform, Product Management, Agile
Optional Skills: Chef, Ansible, Python, Database, Perl, UNIX
Technical Descriptors
7+ years of experience with AWS Cloud with understanding of AWS platform, service offerings and billing.
AWS CloudFormation templates, AWS EC2, VPC and Subnets, S3, ELB/ALB.
Experience in high level design and architectures of networks, servers, infrastructure and other systems for various models such as IaaS, SaaS, PaaS etc.
Experience with setup and administration of databases in AWS (MongoDB, SQL Server, Couchbase databases etc.)
Working experience in a DevOps environment with the team and other stakeholders.
Understanding of Agile, DevOps
Understanding of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and ability to develop and contribute in an IaC environment.
Exposure to and ability to support automation pipeline (Bamboo, Jenkins, etc.)
Have working knowledge on tools such as Jira/Confluence/BitBucket/Git.
Understanding and hands on experience with VMs and Dockers
Certification(s) in AWS
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: IoT Engineer / Specialist – Information Technology
Practice Head - Artificial Intelligence
Description:
Business Plan
Contribute to create a roadmap & business plan for Wipro’s AI business.
Set forth a strategy for M&A & partnerships in this space and lead execution of the strategy
Initiate and lead AI focused engagement with at least one university in US and EU
Contribute to AI engagement with NASSCOMM and NITI and possibly other public or government initiatives across the globe.
Go-To-Market
Formulate differentiated Wipro positioning (industry or process centric) and offerings on AI – endorsed by industry analysts & customers.
Drive demand generation initiatives to ensure 100% growth in demand for AI skills relative to Q4 FY 18 exit
Ensure Wipro is chosen AI partner of choice for minimum 80 of Wipro’s T120 accounts
Secure 4 video testimonials from customers on Wipro’s AI story.
Enable Sales Teams to take the Wipro AI message to market effectively
Marketing & Positioning
Steer key partner initiatives ensuring Wipro is #1 GSI partner on AI for AWS, GCP, MSFT & other specialized AI firms
Engage with Analysts and drive Wipro’s AI positioning – #1 in India based SIs for AI per Gartner and Forrester
Position Wipro as Employer of Choice for AI
AI Messaging – prominent presence of AI on wipro.com, trade journals, social media
Drive visibility for AI in relevant forums globally
Competency and Skill Development
Build scale for AI skills in Wipro through training and competency upskilling
Innovate with AI by infusing it into processes, people and technology
Ecosystem development

Work with stake holders across the Wipro ecosystem (HOLMES, CTO, DAAI, verticals) to develop an integrated AI message for Wipro
Manage & Govern the AI ecosystem across BUs, SLs, functions
Drive AI infusion into our solution offerings by working with various groups
At least 15 years of experience in providing technology services.
Strong leadership capabilities with an excellent track record of business management and growth.
Experience in operating in a collaborative environment. In this role you will be closely working with varied stakeholders across different groups within Wipro.
Passionate about providing customer delight. An aptitude to build and maintain strong connects with C level executives, Advisory Groups, Analysts & Media.
Ability to build and motivate teams, liaison with internal and external groups and mobilize resources effectively while being a thought leader and providing direction to the teams.
Strong sense of Wipro values and personal commitment.

Title: Drug Discovery Intelligence
Description:
JOB PURPOSE (Briefly describe the objectives of the job):
We are looking for a highly motivated scientist with experience in Drug Discovery informatics and Medicinal Chemistry to drive drug discovery projects through application of cutting-edge computational approaches (such as Computational Chemistry and Artificial Intelligence) and in close collaboration with other groups.
The role includes an expectation of research excellence and leadership, development and application of novel computational methods in the respective areas as well as contributions to team and project management.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Ability to manage and grow a team to carry out chemical and biological data analysis
Actively participate in collaborative drug discovery projects on new idea generation and evaluation
Work closely with the development team to tailor drug discovery technologies to better meet discovery project goals
Responsible for providing Medicinal Chemistry expertise to the group
Contribute to evaluation of new target opportunities
Understand and implement project plans
Writing research papers, reports, reviews and summaries
Responsible for client interactions and project deliverables in line with client requirement and contribute to revenue generation as per the business plan.
Responsible for data integrity, archival and access control for client related projects
Comply with all Syngene’s Policies, including Data Integrity, Departmental SOPs, Employees Health and Safety Sustainability, Quality Assurance and Project Management
EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION:
Ph.D. in Computational Chemistry, Medicinal Chemistry, Organic Chemistry, Physical Chemistry, Biochemistry or Pharmacology
WORK EXPERIENCE:
9-12+ years of Drug Discovery experience in the Pharma industry

TECHNICAL /FUNCTIONAL SKILL:
Extensive experience in Medicinal and/or Computational Chemistry
Excellent understanding of Biology, Pharmacology, DMPK and ability to integrate these in Artificial Intelligence methods towards successful project advancement
Deep expertise in the generation and execution of computational / med-chem strategies across all stages of drug discovery
Expertise in applying computational methods including machine learning, structure-based methods and informatics to analyze biological and chemical data
In-depth knowledge in proprietary and public chemical and biological databases, methods and tools.
Extend requisite support to the Team Lead by providing inputs wrt business proposal and technical inputs
BEHAVIORAL/MANAGERIAL SKILLS:
Experience in leading and controlling a project team
Ability to work in a dynamic multidisciplinary environment
Very Good Communication Skills
Should be good at stakeholder management
Should possess strong collaboration skills to work smoothly cross-functionally
OTHER JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Should be flexible to manage the stretched timelines/ discussions/calls/meetings etc.

Title: Manager, Product Development - Artificial Intelligence & Mac...
Description:
Who is Mastercard?
We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless ®. We ensure every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.
Job Title
Manager, Product Development - Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning
Our Vision
AI Garage is responsible for establishing Mastercard as an AI powerhouse. AI will be leveraged and implemented at scale within Mastercard providing a foundational, competitive advantage for the future. All internal processes, all products and services will be enabled by AI continuously advancing our value proposition, consumer experience, and efficiency.

Opportunity
Lead a team of Data Science professionals in Mastercard's AI Garage @ Gurgaon, a newly created strategic business unit within Mastercard, executing on identified use cases for product optimization and operational efficiency securing Mastercard's competitive advantage through all things AI.

Role
Be an AI subject matter expert at Mastercard, responsible for end-to end ownership and execution of assigned AI responsibilities
Ensure all AI solution development is in line with industry standards for data management and privacy compliance including the collection, use, storage, access, retention, output, reporting, and quality of data at Mastercard
Adopt a pragmatic approach to AI, capable of articulating complex technical requirements in a manner this is simple and relevant to stakeholder use cases
Gather relevant information to define the business problem interfacing with global stakeholders
Creative thinker capable of linking AI methodologies to identified business challenges
Identify commonalities amongst use cases enabling a microservice approach to scaling AI at Mastercard, building reusable, multi-purpose models
Develop AI/ML solutions/applications leveraging the latest industry and academic advancements
Leverage open and closed source technologies to solve business problems
Ability to work cross-functionally, and across borders drawing on a broader team of colleagues to effectively execute the AI agenda
Partner with technical teams to implement developed solutions/applications in production environment
Support a learning culture continuously advancing AI capabilities

All About You

Experience
Prior experience leading and developing high performing teams with an emphasis on execution and through-put
Proven track record of developing and implementing AI strategies at scale, solving identified business problems and achieving optimization in the product development and management lifecycle in addition to operational efficiencies
Demonstrated leader capable of executing the AI agenda while managing complex variables including Information and Data Governance, Data Management, Information Security, Privacy & Compliance, Content Life cycle Management, and Records Retention Demonstrated ability to deliver high quality AI solutions in a matrix organization, thinking out of the box and solving hard problems while navigating through ambiguity
8+ years of experience in the Data Sciences field with a focus on AI strategy and execution, developing solutions from scratch, and building local and global teams
Demonstrated expertise in the Data Sciences with established credibility in the field including patent submissions and experience working with start-ups
Demonstrated passion for AI competing in sponsored challenges such as Kaggle
Previous experience with or exposure to:
o Deep Learning algorithm techniques, open source tools and technologies, statistical tools, and programming environments such as Python, R, and SQL
o Big Data platforms such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, GPU Clusters for deep learning
o Classical Machine Learning Algorithms like Logistic Regression, Decision trees, Clustering (K-means, Hierarchical and Self-organizing Maps), TSNE, PCA, Bayesian models, Time Series ARIMA/ARMA, Recommender Systems - Collaborative Filtering, FPMC, FISM, Fossil
o Deep Learning algorithm techniques like Random Forest, GBM, KNN, SVM, Bayesian, Text Mining techniques, Multilayer Perceptron, Neural Networks – Feedforward, CNN, LSTM’s GRU’s is a plus. Optimization techniques – Activity regularization (L1 and L2), Adam, Adagrad, Adadelta concepts; Cost Functions in Neural Nets – Contrastive Loss, Hinge Loss, Binary Cross entropy, Categorical Cross entropy; developed applications in KRR, NLP, Speech and Image processing
o Deep Learning frameworks for Production Systems like Tensorflow, Keras (for RPD and neural net architecture evaluation), PyTorch and Xgboost, Caffe, and Theono is a plus
Exposure or experience using collaboration tools such as:
o Confluence (Documentation)
o Bitbucket/Stash (Code Sharing)
o Shared Folders (File Sharing)
o ALM (Project Management)
Knowledge of payments industry a plus
Experience with SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) process is a plus

Effectiveness
Effective at managing and validating assumptions with key stakeholders in compressed timeframes, without hampering development momentum
Capable of navigating a complex organization in a relentless pursuit of answers and clarity
Enthusiasm for Data Sciences enabling the identification, design, and deployment of optimal AI and machine learning business opportunities and the creative application of AI techniques to improve an organization's effectiveness
Proven thought-leadership when evaluating business problems and architecting a cohesive solution
Ability to understand technical system architecture and overarching function along with interdependency elements, as well as anticipate challenges for immediate remediation
Ability to unpack complex problems into addressable segments and evaluate AI methods most applicable to addressing the segment
Incredible attention to detail and focus instilling confidence without qualification in developed solutions

Core Capabilities
Strong written and oral communication skills
Strong project management skills
Experience leading teams a plus
Bachelor's degree required. Advanced degree in Management, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or other quantitative fields desirable
Some international travel required

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities:
Solve complex business problems of global organizations by applying AI and Machine Learning techniques in combination with NLP and computer vision.
Design new machine learning models for the organization's product suite.
Implement machine learning models and fine-tune them for different use cases.
Systemic study of the latest research and industry developments in Artificial Intelligence. Leverage these developments to solve real-world business problems.
Automate manual processes, optimize data-delivery and build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data required for a wide variety of use-cases using SQL/ETL.
Design competitive AI/ML services and user experience for next-generation devices and create prototypes for demonstration.
Build real-time and batch analytics platform for analytics & machine-learning.
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve ML models/infrastructure and software that uses these models.
Create algorithms to extract information from a large data set to perform statistical analysis and analyze the same to create predictive models.


Requirements:
Hands On experience of existing AI/ML platforms.
Experience in complete modeling process (Problem statement definition, Data exploration & pre-processing, Feature Engineering, Model Building, Testing & Validation).
Practical experience using ML methods for classification, clustering and estimation, such as Decision Trees, Random Forests, Extreme Gradient Boosting, Ridge Regression, PCA and SVM.
Practical experience in deep learning and optimizing neural networks.
Expert in SQL .Understands Data very well and has extensive Data Modeling experience.
Familiarity with database (SQL, Oracle, Stored Procedures, MongoDB) and can work with relational as well as non-relational databases.
Expert in Object-oriented programming concepts and principles.
Strong analytical skills and passion for building world-class user experiences, combined with a vision to think big.
Should be an expert in handling various data types and structures: structured, unstructured, voice, image and video data, static versus streaming data.
Prior experience in integrating data, profiling, validating and cleansing data in Big Data platforms will be a plus.
Strong background with advanced mathematical concepts related to Probabilistic Models, Linear Algebra, Calculus, and Optimization will be a plus.
Good technical writing, reporting & communication skills.
An autonomous team player- Curious, Proactive and Communicative.

Title: Java8, Kafka Streams, Machine Learning, AI Developer
Description:

Software Developer (5+yrs) n Lead Developer (7+yrs) in Data Pipeline and Big Data

The Digital Products team aims to bring successful technology-based products to market in a high-growth environment. The teams mission is focused on accelerating technology adoption in commercial real estate by bringing creative, innovative and technical solutions to solve large, complex problems for our clients.

Experience in building large scale distributed systems and knowledge of enterprise architecture patterns. Knowledge of distributed system concepts such as Leadership, Consensus, Replication and Partitioning
Experience in build automation tools such as Gradle, Jenkins, Docker Images and Artifactory
Experience in working with Container Management/Orchestration Systems such as Kubernetes, Apache Mesos, AWS ECS, etc
Experience with Stream Analysis and ML with tools such as Spark, Apache Flink, etc
Experience with building instrumented, scalable, highly available, and secure systems
Hiring and retaining top engineers in the Integration team
Experience with one or more public clouds (AWS, GCP, Azure)
5+ years of hands on Java development with 2 years in building data processing applications using Spring Boot
BS in EE or CS

Title: Git + AWS Cloud Engineer
Description:
Klizo Solutions develops mobile apps, websites, and software. We work in some really cool technology like facial recognition, artificial intelligence, and even blockchain. We have about 25 people in the team, and we are are doubling in size over the next couple months. We are looking for good people to join our rapidly growing company.
As a key member of our team, the AWS Cloud Engineer will work with development teams and other DevOps engineers to solve critical issues while improving customer experience. Other responsibilities include:
Build and support scalable microservices and system orchestration.
Design, development, and testing of features delivered as applications and/or services.
Investigate and contribute to solving issues in production environments.
Provide collaborative conduit between various technical and non-technical teams.
Build effective monitoring, alerts, and metrics for production services.
Build effective DevOps services, processes, and tooling.
Supporting applications and/or services as and when required on a 24x7 basis.

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or Mathematics
Minimum of 7 years of software engineering experience
Minimum of 4 years of AWS technology delivery experience
AWS Certified Developer highly desired

'Make-it-happen' attitude, the innate capacity for ownership and timely delivery of results in a fast-paced environment
Strong knowledge of microservice and SoA architectures.

Experience with HTTP APIs and RESTful web services
Understanding of web browser APIs and behavior
Excellent technical communication skills
Competent in designing and building web applications and/or web services in a commercial setting
Competent in design/implementation for reliability, availability, scalability and performance
Competent in software engineering tools (e.g. build tools) and best practices (e.g. test automation and continuous integration)
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with automated testing, test-driven development and/or behavior-driven development
Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers
Meticulous attention to detail
Ability to multi-task while ensuring high quality of results
Dedication to high standards of code quality and testing
Passion for building a rich and innovative user experience
Demonstrable track record as an owner: someone who can take a concept and make it real

Experience with source control systems especially GIT
Application Performance Monitoring (APM) experience (e.g. Dynatrace, App Dynamics, New Relic)
Ability to monitor and troubleshoot a very large complex system of services
Cognizant of modern database/storage technologies
Experience with automated testing tools (e.g. Selenium, JMeter).

Experience with building PWA and native customer facing applications
Experience with build CI/CD systems like Jenkins, Travis or TFS

Title: Vendor Management Lead
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
Manage and effectively lead a group of technical staff to ensure the successful operations of the Mass Market Operations business based within several Industry Partners in India. Achieve agreed customer service delivery and business targets for all associated Fixed wireline and Mobility support functions
This role will be key to enabling the continued evolution of our business model to streamline our Operations in India. You will lead a small but potent team in the ICC that will be accountable for the service delivery performance of our Industry Partners in India for Fixed Wireline and Mobile Activations. You will be accountable for building effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders and the development of the Mass Market operations team in the Innovation Capability Centre as we realign and optimise our service delivery footprint
Key Accountabilities
Guide and support our Industry Partners to achieve SLA performance, customer experience expectations and quality standards within budget.
Oversee performance to Operational KPIs and assist with driving the Industry Partners to achieve key deliverables (see Activation Metrics)
Conduct daily/weekly performance stand-ups with the industry partner leadership teams and act as a conduit between the cross functional teams in Telstra and the partner should there be any escalations
Understand Telstra’s Risk and Compliance Framework (e.g. Privacy risk, Security risk, IT Risk etc.) and support/ facilitate partner in developing suitable Plans to ensure compliance (e.g. Business Continuity Plans)
Ensuring there is no risk to Telstra’s Regulatory obligations – Meet and exceed on the industry regulatory standards [ACMA]
Build highly effective relationships with your peers and all stakeholders and the development of the team
Build and maintain solid, productive relationships with industry partners and other operational leads to ensure consistency and improvement across the entire activation episode.
Work with the partners to execute troubleshooting exercises required to ensure order progression, including escalation into dependant groups where required (i.e. Field workforce, Sales, IT)
Identification and resolution of partner pain points, including feedback to the vertical on systemic issues requiring improvement
Monitoring of quality and compliance through presence on the floor – partner with the quality teams to ensure the quality framework meets business needs
Maintain the business area Operating / Engagement Model, updating it as new situations arise
Input into the monthly forecasting process, to ensure the Operational lead has appropriate input to sign off on forecast [i.e. – AHT reviews]
Providing Key Operational input to shape the contractual obligations from a commercial stand point
Ensure effective reporting frameworks are in place to support monitoring of key operational metrics
Co-ordinate post-implementation reviews of projects or plans, and analyse their impact on the achievement of the groups KPIs
Act as the point of contact for any incident management or business continuity events [Downtime due to systems being offline, weather and political events] that severely impact operations
Collaborate with the partner to develop glide paths to recovery based on factual evidence, performance standards and staffing levels and ensure the partner delivers on the stated glide paths
Ensure the partner teams are 100% compliant with all Telstra mandatory training course – i.e. Business Essentials
Accountable for the implementation of new processes & procedures. This may include a small scale, fully operational, implementation of a new process - to learn how to bring the change into complete readiness
Conduct weekly/fortnightly ride-on’s to understand the process gaps and determine improvement opportunities
Develop a 30-60-90-day program of work to improve the partners performance and also undertake analysis, research & diagnosis to identify patterns, trends or issues that need a solution or resolution to be developed
Onsite guidance and support for any future Transition activities. Provide “on-site” health checks for the project team for any transition with the aim of achieving Tollgate on or before plan
Skill & Experience: 8 + yrs
Relevant experience in Leading diverse teams
Relevant tertiary qualifications (e.g. business, commercial, management, procurement) coupled with 5 to 10 years demonstrated experience (i.e. considered a specialist in field)
Experience in driving operational improvement programs across third-party service providers, especially in India.
Experience delivering significant cost savings over the life of Partner contracts
Experience engaging and influencing senior stakeholders, both internal and external, to achieve business objectives
Commercial management experience and contribution to solving complex problems.
Proven ability to contribute to and inform strategy development within area of expertise
Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working in a complex, cross functional company such as Telstra
International BPO Experience

Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Software-Senior Engineer(CPQ Architect)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
CPQ Technical Architect will work with business stakeholders and ITS colleagues in the implementation and support of Cloudsense CPQ at Telstra. This position offers diversity in projects, an opportunity to work in a team environment with autonomy and a high-level of responsibility. There are also excellent opportunities for professional growth and advancement within Telstra Customer Platforms and broader Telstra systems.
CPQ Technical Architect is responsible for leading technical CPQ low level architecture activities for Telstra across requirement analysis, design, development and implementation on Telstra’s key CRM platforms. They will be responsible for developing and coordinating technical delivery aspects of all Telstra’s CRM systems implementations, communicating effectively and fostering strong relationships with business users and stakeholders.
The purpose of the role is to take responsibility for ensuring all requests from the business are developed and delivered in the most optimal way taking into consideration business roadmaps, ITS CRM Strategy, industry best practice, vendor roadmaps and thought leadership and innovation delivering a competitive advantage to Telstra.
He will participate in and/or be responsible for technical analysis of functional designs, preparation of technical designs, technical build & implementation of CRM, CRM configuration and scripting, quality & code reviews, facilitating testing, resolution of defects identified during test, managing relationships between support and development team, mentoring and training
Key Accountabilities
Salesforce Technical Architect role is to plan, coordinate, and execute all activities related to the requirements interpretation, design and implementation of CPQ, CLM applications. This individual will apply proven industry and technology experience as well as communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to issues related to design, development, and deployment of mission-critical CRM systems with a focus on quality application development and delivery.
This role is key to the success of the Customer Platforms function at Telstra and will be responsible and accountable for the following:
Ability to design and develop Salesforce CRM, Cloudsense CPQ & Force.com Applications
Ability to review vendor designs and recommended solutions based on industry best practises
Ability to provide technical governance across Cloudsense CPQ solutions at Telstra
Assess and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the Salesforce application solutions to ensure user requirements and business objectives are met in a timely and cost effective manner
Understand overall business operations and develops innovative solutions to help improve productivity
Ability to understand and design provisioning solutions at Telstra and how CRM interacts with provisioning layers.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills needed to support enterprise high availability Salesforce applications
Coordinate with technical resource within and outside of Customer Platforms team.
Monitor process of software configuration/development/testing to assure quality deliverable.
Ensure standards of QA are being met
Review deliverables to verify that they meet client and contract expectations; Implement and enforce high standards for quality deliverables
Analyses performance and capacity issues of the highest complexity with Salesforce application.
Demonstrate thought Leadership in Cloudsense CPQ innovations and practices.
Assists leadership with development and management of new application capabilities to improve productivity
Provide training and educate other team members around core capabilities and helps them deliver high quality solutions and deliverables/documentation
Self-Motivator to perform Design / Develop user requirements, test and deploy the changes into production
Skill & Experience : 12 + yrs
SFDC, APEX, Conga, Appttus, Cloudsense
Technical Descriptors
Salesforce – Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Force. Com platform
Salesforce Certified Developer / Advanced Developer / Technical Architect is essential
Experience in building applications on force.com platform with extensive hands-on and subject matter expertise in Salesforce technology including
Full cycle implementation experience with SFDC (application design, architecture and development using Salesforce.com)
Strong SFDC knowledge and Integration components for SFDC (SFDC APIs, Apex controllers, Apex Web Services, Apex callout, outbound messaging, SFDC data loaders, etc.)
Command over APEX and Visual force
Hands on experience in building salesforce apex classes, test classes and deployment process.
Deep knowledge of Salesforce API’s and hands on experience in building custom API’s and integration.
Working knowledge of web frameworks – HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JSON, Ajax
working knowledge of all Atlassian tools a bonus
Expertise in developing CPQ capability using Cloudsense.
Proven experience of working with Telco Clients to configure products, Baskets, Order Orchestration and Technical Enrichment.
Certifications in Appttus and Conga would be essential.
Expertise in developing Contract management solution integrating into CPQ using Conga or Appttus
Proven experience with creation of relevant documentation including, but not limited to Apttus CPQ solution design document and requirements documentation
Experience with migration of CPQ across environments including experience with the Apttus migration tool
Knowledge of the fundamental capabilities of Apttus CPQ including but not limited to:
Quoting and Quote Templates
Approvals (Deal Manager/IWA preferred)
X- Author
Fundamental understanding of Apttus CLM capabilities, Apttus CLM 201 certification a plus
Experience with Apttus Advanced Workflow Approvals
