Title: Software-Senior Engineer(CPQ Architect)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
CPQ Technical Architect is responsible for leading technical CPQ low level architecture activities for Telstra across requirement analysis, design, development and implementation on Telstra’s key CRM platforms. They will be responsible for developing and coordinating technical delivery aspects of all Telstra’s CRM systems implementations, communicating effectively and fostering strong relationships with business users and stakeholders.
The purpose of the role is to take responsibility for ensuring all requests from the business are developed and delivered in the most optimal way taking into consideration business roadmaps, ITS CRM Strategy, industry best practice, vendor roadmaps and thought leadership and innovation delivering a competitive advantage to Telstra.
He will participate in and/or be responsible for technical analysis of functional designs, preparation of technical designs, technical build & implementation of CRM, CRM configuration and scripting, quality & code reviews, facilitating testing, resolution of defects identified during test, managing relationships between support and development team, mentoring and training
Key Accountabilities
Salesforce Technical Architect role is to plan, coordinate, and execute all activities related to the requirements interpretation, design and implementation of CPQ, CLM applications. This individual will apply proven industry and technology experience as well as communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to issues related to design, development, and deployment of mission-critical CRM systems with a focus on quality application development and delivery.
This role is key to the success of the Customer Platforms function at Telstra and will be responsible and accountable for the following:
Ability to design and develop Salesforce CRM, Cloudsense CPQ & Force.com Applications
Ability to review vendor designs and recommended solutions based on industry best practises
Ability to provide technical governance across Cloudsense CPQ solutions at Telstra
Assess and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the Salesforce application solutions to ensure user requirements and business objectives are met in a timely and cost effective manner
Understand overall business operations and develops innovative solutions to help improve productivity
Ability to understand and design provisioning solutions at Telstra and how CRM interacts with provisioning layers.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills needed to support enterprise high availability Salesforce applications
Coordinate with technical resource within and outside of Customer Platforms team.
Monitor process of software configuration/development/testing to assure quality deliverable.
Ensure standards of QA are being met
Review deliverables to verify that they meet client and contract expectations; Implement and enforce high standards for quality deliverables
Analyses performance and capacity issues of the highest complexity with Salesforce application.
Demonstrate thought Leadership in Cloudsense CPQ innovations and practices.
Assists leadership with development and management of new application capabilities to improve productivity
Provide training and educate other team members around core capabilities and helps them deliver high quality solutions and deliverables/documentation
Self-Motivator to perform Design / Develop user requirements, test and deploy the changes into production
Skill & Experience : 12 + yrs
SFDC, APEX, Conga, Appttus, Cloudsense
Technical Descriptors
Salesforce – Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Force. Com platform
Salesforce Certified Developer / Advanced Developer / Technical Architect is essential
Experience in building applications on force.com platform with extensive hands-on and subject matter expertise in Salesforce technology including
Full cycle implementation experience with SFDC (application design, architecture and development using Salesforce.com)
Strong SFDC knowledge and Integration components for SFDC (SFDC APIs, Apex controllers, Apex Web Services, Apex callout, outbound messaging, SFDC data loaders, etc.)
Command over APEX and Visual force
Hands on experience in building salesforce apex classes, test classes and deployment process.
Deep knowledge of Salesforce API’s and hands on experience in building custom API’s and integration.
Working knowledge of web frameworks – HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JSON, Ajax
working knowledge of all Atlassian tools a bonus
Expertise in developing CPQ capability using Cloudsense.
Proven experience of working with Telco Clients to configure products, Baskets, Order Orchestration and Technical Enrichment.
Certifications in Appttus and Conga would be essential.
Expertise in developing Contract management solution integrating into CPQ using Conga or Appttus
Proven experience with creation of relevant documentation including, but not limited to Apttus CPQ solution design document and requirements documentation
Experience with migration of CPQ across environments including experience with the Apttus migration tool
Knowledge of the fundamental capabilities of Apttus CPQ including but not limited to:
Quoting and Quote Templates
Approvals (Deal Manager/IWA preferred)
X- Author
Fundamental understanding of Apttus CLM capabilities, Apttus CLM 201 certification a plus
Experience with Apttus Advanced Workflow Approvals
Experience with X-Author for Excel and Contracts
Experience with Apttus Wizard
Familiar with Apttus admin settings, Apttus custom settings and DocuSign settings.
Knowledge of Apttus development
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Associate Product Manager / Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Job Description
Come aboard our growing global team, and work for a category leader with a market presence in 15 countries. You will work with some of the leading financial institutions worldwide who rely on our product innovation in helping them shield themselves against the global $4 trillion problem of financial fraud. We create ‘customer-centric predictable enterprises’ and we do this by directing intelligence to the heart of every customer interaction. In real-time.
The Opportunity
Be a member of the Product Management Group (PMG) in leading life cycle management of real-time intelligent software products to enrich customer experience and enterprise financial crime management in banking domain
Practice the art of complex enterprise software product management from conception through release till evolution.
Be part of a young and effervescent strategic group where opportunities for growth, learning and thinking are unbound.
Keep abreast with software product management community and developments across the globe and constantly innovate by implementing novel ideas.
You will
Involved in whole product life cycle management starting from conceptualizing an idea, market validations, product development, product positioning, product promotion & product evolution.
Responsible for converting the innovative solutions into business propositions and showcasing the innovative applications to customers and winning business for CustomerXPs.
Capture the functional requirements and facilitate and manage the development priorities with key stakeholders and customers.
Has to work closely with customers, prospects, partners and CustomerXPs sales and account management team to convert ideas to salable innovative propositions.
Engage in frequent customer/prospect dialog to ensure understanding of requirements and translate the same into detailed specifications.
Provide RFI/RFP response within product ownership area
Impart product demonstrations to prospects/alliance partners at onsite or from offshore over the web.

Provide product information to meet internal and external needs, including sales collateral, press releases, web site copy and internal training.
Keep close watch on competitors’ offerings/activities and facilitate decisions to support innovative business propositions on time.
Proactively drive the creation of new features based on an understanding of the customer’s business as well as market requirements.
Participate in industry forum activities by publishing whitepapers, writing and responding to blogs, participate in seminars, webinars etc.
Personal qualities
Self-motivation, enthusiasm and results-focus
Flexible, adaptable and comfortable with ambiguity
Pragmatic and solution-oriented
Committed to high standards and continuous improvement
Ability to move between big picture and detail
Desired work experience
4-10 years of experiences as a Banking Business Analyst / Domain Consultant / Product Manager in the areas of Core Banking / Digital Banking / Cards / Payments / Corporate Banking / AML / Fraud detection.
Candidates with experience in the areas enterprise fraud management/fraud detection/financial crime management/AML will be preferred.
Preferred Education Background
Engineering + MBA from top B-schools
About Us
Endorsed Best Fraud Detection Product by Risk.net and consistently featured in Chartis RiskTech Quadrants for anti-fraud technology, CustomerXPs continues to redefine real-time, cross-channel Banking Enterprise Fraud Management with its human brain like approach to fighting financial crime. Harnessing the combined power of Automation, Artificial Intelligence, Decision Sciences and Real-time Decisions, CustomerXPs’ real-time, cross-channel product Clari5 processes over 8 bn transactions, manages over 200 mn accounts and reliably secures 4% of the global population’s banking transactions. With 80 mn accounts at a single site, Clari5 has the world’s largest implementation of a fraud management solution. Tier 1 banking customers across 5 geographies who trust Clari5 for driving their fraud management strategy are recipients of global industry acclaim, including Banking Technology’s Best Use of IT in Risk Management/Regulation and Celent’s Model Bank of the Year.

Title: IA Technical Delivery Lead
Description:
About the opportunity
Department Description
Intelligent Automation is a newly formed, dynamic and exciting multi-skilled team that that will design, build and execute an automation strategy using Process Excellence, Robotic Process Automation, Digital and other automation tools.
Delivering sustainable change across Fidelity by focusing on top down, strategic business priorities to maximise business and commercial value
Empowering and upskilling internal teams to create sustainable capability, and promote a culture of innovation and continuous improvement as part of new and improved ways or working
Leveraging an integrated operating model to work with IT, Risk, Compliance, and Shared Services with an objective to deliver better outcomes for the business and our customers
Purpose of the Role
As a member of the Intelligent Automation Delivery Team, this role will work to progress Fidelity’s IA agenda and embed innovation, working with the business to design, develop and run automated tools to maximise business benefits.
Specifically, this role will act as an advocate of Intelligent Automation and its benefits, advising and driving the technical use of the automationtools in line with the strategy and design principles and supporting the engagement with the business to generate and maintain buy in, whilst overseeing the technical delivery of IA projects to meet the needs and requirements of Fidelity.
Key Responsibilities
Intelligent Automation technical application
Provides expert aubject matter knowledge on the technical application of automation tools, specifically Blue Prism and how to deploy in an agile methodology
Understands the architectural design of the software and how it interacts with system applications and be able to proficantly articulate this to technical and non technical stakeholders
Demonstrable experience of creating and delivering technical deisgn solutions that meet business outcomes aligned to technology strategy and customer experience.
Intelligent Automation project delivery

Oversees the technical design and delivery within the IA scrum teams of automation projects in order to meet the needs and requirements of the client and Fidelity at large
Ensures process automation and optimisation projects are commercially viable and meet the strategic aims of Fidelity and / or business unit as part of business case
Works with the Techncial and Design Authority Lead to understand and execute best practice and design principles aligned the to the IA governance framework and methodology, supporting future deisgn thinking and methodology approaches
Provides expert and balanced subject matter knowledge for the successful deployment of the IA methodology as part of project delivery e.g. RPA
Supports and facilitates the firm-wide opportunity assessment and development of the overall IA business case
Works with the Governance & Design Authority to ensure compliance with all regulatory and compliance management frameworks
Intelligent Automation business engagement & stakeholder relationships

Acts as an advocate of IA across the business and maintains strong ongoing relationships to help educate and identify / shape future project demand
Works in partnership with business stakeholders on an ongoing basis and provides IA function representation in relevant BU forums, governance, meetings and other initiatives
Provides appropriate challenge to the business, ensuring opportunities, including updates to existing live automation solutions, are assessed, selected and prioritised with a strategic lens and in line with the standards set by the CoE

Intelligent Automation Centre of Excellence support
Provides up to date awareness of current and future market and technology developments inside and outside of the IA team through offerings, white papers, blogs, upskilling and learning opportunities etc.
Role models desired behaviours, supporting the execution of the IA strategy, driving quality and ensuring compliance with governance standards and the risk and control framework, as set by the CoE
Coaching & leading others
Acts as an advisor for IA team members and leads, motivates and develops in-direct reports to maximise the engagement and motivation of delivery team members in the achievement of their objectives utilising the Fidelity performance management framework, role model behaviours and the culture & values of Fidelity
Provides inputs of the learning requirements, knowledge and skills of delivery team members in order to maintain the skill management system of the IA Delivery Team
Experience and Qualifications Required
Established track record in similar capacity / industry / coverage with demonstrable experience within project management and stakeholder engagement
Excellent communication and leadership skills, with a proven track record of influencing and motivating others at a senior level to achieve results and exceed targets. Ability to communicate complex and emotive topics to different audiences through a range of data, written and verbal methods
Proven experience of leadership within the transformation of a business including significant personal contribution to the success of the initiative and the measurable impact on customers, employees and performance
Significant experience of reviewing and changing business models and practices to optimise performance and generate cost savings and improvements whilst delivering employee and customer benefits
Demonstrable experience in specialist professional and technical tools such as: Automation (RPA, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence), Operational Excellence approaches and methods (Lean thinking, Process excellence, System & Management Thinking), Performance Analytics, Performance Management, Service Delivery, Operational Change Management, P&L Management
Significant experience in deploying best practices for Process Excellence, RPA and Automation within a mid - large organisation
Experience of preparing, delivering updates, strategies and presentations to all parts of the organisation (up to Senior management level)
Substantial change management experience across multi-functional, multi-site, multi-product and multi-distribution channels
Proven project and programme management experience and ability to deliver results in a fast paced and energetic environment
Proven experience of building team dynamics to deliver outcomes through a structured approach. Capable of coaching and mentoring team members to shape performance improvement outcomes while building individual and team capability
Experience of delivering capability building and training to business stakeholders at all levels: awareness, tools & techniques, technical subject matter, leader, case studies etc.
Excellent stakeholder and influencing skills, including communication, negotiation of deadlines and requirements, management of expectation, recommendations, quality of outputs etc.
Demonstrable experience of working to conceptual briefs provided by an internal or external stakeholders and clients
Relationship management experience, particularly regarding the performance of outsourcing (as a customer or provider)
Education:
First degree level (Bachelor’s degree) or equivalent
Desirable: MBA and/or consultancy experience
Knowledge of the financial service industry
We are committed to being an inclusive and diverse company to work for and strive to create a culture where flexible working is encouraged so that we retain and attract the best talent by offering working patterns that suit both individual and business needs.
About you
About Fidelity International
Fidelity International offers world class investment solutions and retirement expertise. As a privately owned, independent company, investment is our only business. We are driven by the needs of our clients, not by shareholders. Our vision is to deliver innovative client solutions for a better future.
Our people are passionate, engaged, smart and curious, and we give them the independence and the confidence to make a difference. While we take pride in the excellence of our investment solutions and client service, we know we can always do better. We are honest, respectful and make tough calls, challenging the status quo to achieve better outcomes through innovation. Above all else, we always put our clients first.
Find out more about what we do, our history, and how you could be part of our future at:
www.fidelityrecruitment.com/about-us

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
About Microsoft AI & Research Org

AI & Research is a new group formed at Microsoft solving to accelerate our innovation in AI, and to enable Microsoft to create truly intelligent systems and products for our customers.
When we launched Bing on June 1st of 2009, we changed search forever and created a foundational technology for AI. Bing’s market share has grown incredibly since the launch, and we serve over a third of U.S. queries, and power the partners Yahoo, Apple, Amazon and AOL for search.

Our investments in ML and AI technologies in Bing have been heavily leveraged throughout the company from Azure taking advantage of AutoPilot, Cosmos and the Edge, to our new investments in Conversation-as-a-Platform (CaaP) where we are leading the industry.

The largest example of using the Bing technologies was the creation of Cortana – our personal digital assistant, who has answered 12 billion questions for 130 million users. Cortana got us into the digital agent game. Watch this Satya's Ignite keynote on how we’re democratizing AI using Cortana.

Harry Shum is the Executive Vice President of Artificial Intelligence & Research at Microsoft. Here is his vision on AI. Video.

Responsibilities
What is in it for you?

Are you excited about building world-class software, working on data/algorithms, learning, having fun and maintaining work-life balance?

In your journey with Microsoft, you will be applying your computer science skills to innovate, design and implement solutions for cutting edge web scale problems. You will also get an opportunity to work on Big Data and employ ML techniques in search space.

Our team comprises of highly motivated researchers, engineers, product managers and data-scientists building end-to-end web-scale and enterprise-scale AI systems. Together we develop and deliver robust, state of art and scalable solutions across a rich set of scenarios.

We are hiring talented, energetic, creative and passionate software engineers with experience in shipping/building high-quality software products/services.

Roles & Responsibilities

Design, develop, test, deploy scalable intelligent services
Analyze risks and compromises with various design choices
Collaborate with Partners and address customer needs
Qualifications
BS/MS degree in Computer Science or related quantitative field with 6+ years of relevant experience
Strong software design and coding skills
Experience in developing distributed and large scale infrastructure components
Experience with recommendation systems, text processing systems, ranking systems, speech recognition systems or similar machine learning systems, a plus
Passion for new technologies, quality, and customer satisfaction
Excellent communication and collaboration skills

At Microsoft, we believe in not only working/building careers but also giving a life experience. Vidya Srinivisan has shared one of her such experience here.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

Title: Research Analyst
Description:

Required experience – 1-2 Years
About Innoplexus
Innoplexus offers Data as a Service and Continuous Analytics as a Service products, leveraging Artificial Intelligence and advanced analytics to help reduce the drug development time, from synthesis to approval, significantly.
Our products leverage proprietary algorithms and patent-pending technologies to help global Life Sciences and Pharmaceuticals organizations with access to relevant data, real-time intelligence & intuitive insights, across pre-clinical, clinical, regulatory and commercial stages of a drug.
We automate the collection, curation, aggregation, and analysis, of billions of data points from thousands of data sources, using machine learning, network analysis, ontologies, computer vision and entity normalization.
Responsibilities:
Researching scientific data pertaining to a particular topic and finding answers to specific questions based on product/client requirements.
Presenting desired scientific information to other members of the team or clients in a manner that it is easily understood.
Keeping pace with new developments, publications, conferences, activities etc. relevant to the particular scientific field of requirement.
Summarizing research findings and making self-explanatory Excel sheets/PowerPoint presentations for other colleagues of the team.
Regular discussions with other team members towards discussing the progress of current work, finding ways to furnish missing information and working together to meet the company as well as client deadlines in time.
Required experience
1-2 years of experience working in a Pharma based company (desirable)
Strong analytical skills, structured problem solving attitude, excellent written & verbal skills, good knowledge of MS office & other analytical tools for day-to-day use.
An open mind to learn and discover new approaches to achieve a goal.
Required qualification
PhD/Masters in Life sciences.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
We're looking for an amazing technologist to be the Architect in our SBSEG organization, expanding our global footprint and transforming the QuickBooks product to a highly scalable, performant and delightful product for customers. QuickBooks is world's No. 1 Cloud Accounting solution serving millions of small & medium businesses worldwide. We are looking for a talented and bright Architect to help us accelerate our growth worldwide. Imagine working on a code that's going through a major refactoring with 2.5+ million paid users, serving 160+ countries worldwide in multiple languages. The target Architecture is microservices in AWS and Java based back end platform and ReactJS, GraphQL and Relay/Redux technologies for the front end. We take page load times extremely seriously, take pride in designing picture perfect pixels, and build functionality with mobile and global first mindset. You will be working in startup mode mentality and everyday will greet you with interesting challenges. You job is to ensure we maintain our Architecture goals working out of our India Bangalore team and collaborating with other Architects worldwide.


You will need to be hands-on technical leader, rubbing shoulders with engineers, connecting the business and technology, work closely with customers, product managers, coach Staff and senior engineers in the team. If you want to be part of something big and special, it's the job for you. There has never been a better time to be an Architect within Intuit's Small Business & Self-Employed Group. Come join us and be a part of this exciting journey and write history.


Responsibilities:
Work in a startup group within in Intuit that's powering mid sized companies grow and scale their businesses in the cloud.
Build and deploy features quickly at scale and do work that will impact the financial lives of millions of small businesses across the globe, tapping into a new segment of business for Intuit.
Work with multiple teams across the globe across horizontal features within the small business ecosystem.
Build highly performant services and systems that scale with millions of transactions for mid sized companies. Through machine learning and artificial intelligence, unlock the power of our data sets and harness our ecosystem to bring the power of many for the prosperity of one.
Drive the adoption of a hybrid cloud model.


Requirements:
Hands on experience with designing and building web scale SaaS products that serves millions of users globally with varying business and compliance regulations.
Expertise around full stack technologies.
Leadership to define architectural strategies, standards and practices to enable integrations of the platform within Intuit and outside with third party developers.
Passion for being hands on techie, with Devops mindset.
Deep customer empathy and ability to quickly translate learnings into solid, scalable architecture w/ a mobile first approach.
Deep knowledge around building Global products.
Innovative & entrepreneurial approach to building products that make a profound difference in customer's life.
Ability to lead the highest of profile projects & products, directly impacting the future growth of Intuit.
Ability to lead & influence technical & non-technical audiences across organizational ladder, product lines and geographies.
5+ years' experience developing software with extensive knowledge and experience building SaaS based applications on AWS & hybrid cloud environments.
Experience having driven programs as an application Architect involving various Web and/or Mobile and cloud technologies.
Experience of designing and developing applications in cloud environments like AWS.
Experience in SOA and microservice based architecture approaches.
Experience in breaking up large monolithic applications into collections of smaller independent services for simplifying development will be a big plus.
Strong experience with a modern front-end SPA framework (React.js, Angular, Ember, etc.), OR modern Java/J2EE technologies.
A strong viewpoint and/or experience with global. mobile, social product mindset.
Experience developing, maintaining, and innovating large scale, consumer facing web or mobile applications.
Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex.

Title: Senior Automation QA Engineer (Remote/Work-from-home)
Description:
WalletHub is one of the leading personal finance destinations in the US and rapidly growing. We’re looking for a motivated, hardworking, and competitive Senior Automation QA Engineer for a full-time, permanent position.
The expected work schedule is 7 AM to 7 PM EST Monday to Friday, including a 1h break.
Responsibilities
Testing and assuring high quality performance of website
Reporting and validating bugs for all components
Creating test plans and test cases
Creating and maintaining automated tests using Selenium and Java
Identifying opportunities for improvement and making constructive suggestions for change
Qualifications
You are the ideal candidate for this job if you have:
At least 3 years of hands-on experience in Test Automation with Java and Selenium
At least 4 years experience in Manual Testing
Excellent attention to details
Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Willingness to work hard
Proficient in written/spoken English
Compensation
Very competitive salary based on prior experience and qualifications
Potential for stock options after the first year
Raise and advancement opportunities based on periodic evaluations
The ability to work overtime for added income
100% remote position
Visa sponsorship (after 24 months with the company, based on performance, in case you will be working from outside the US)
How to apply
To get our attention, all you need to do is apply on Indeed and include your updated resume as well as a brief message telling us why you are the right candidate.If we believe that you will be a good match, we'll contact you to arrange the next steps of the application process.
Please know that we appreciate your interest in our company but due to the high number of applications we are unable to get back to candidates who have not been selected to move forward.
Note
This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed remotely from outside the U.S. without the need for U.S. work authorization.
More about WalletHub
WalletHub is a high-growth fintech company based in Washington, D.C. that is looking for talented, hard-working individuals to help us reshape personal finance. More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:
1) Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.
2) Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.
3) Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.
In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹960,000.00 to ₹2,100,000.00 /year

Title: Software-Senior Engineer(CPQ Architect)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
CPQ Technical Architect will work with business stakeholders and ITS colleagues in the implementation and support of Cloudsense CPQ at Telstra. This position offers diversity in projects, an opportunity to work in a team environment with autonomy and a high-level of responsibility. There are also excellent opportunities for professional growth and advancement within Telstra Customer Platforms and broader Telstra systems.
CPQ Technical Architect is responsible for leading technical CPQ low level architecture activities for Telstra across requirement analysis, design, development and implementation on Telstra’s key CRM platforms. They will be responsible for developing and coordinating technical delivery aspects of all Telstra’s CRM systems implementations, communicating effectively and fostering strong relationships with business users and stakeholders.
The purpose of the role is to take responsibility for ensuring all requests from the business are developed and delivered in the most optimal way taking into consideration business roadmaps, ITS CRM Strategy, industry best practice, vendor roadmaps and thought leadership and innovation delivering a competitive advantage to Telstra.
He will participate in and/or be responsible for technical analysis of functional designs, preparation of technical designs, technical build & implementation of CRM, CRM configuration and scripting, quality & code reviews, facilitating testing, resolution of defects identified during test, managing relationships between support and development team, mentoring and training
Key Accountabilities
Salesforce Technical Architect role is to plan, coordinate, and execute all activities related to the requirements interpretation, design and implementation of CPQ, CLM applications. This individual will apply proven industry and technology experience as well as communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to issues related to design, development, and deployment of mission-critical CRM systems with a focus on quality application development and delivery.
This role is key to the success of the Customer Platforms function at Telstra and will be responsible and accountable for the following:
Ability to design and develop Salesforce CRM, Cloudsense CPQ & Force.com Applications
Ability to review vendor designs and recommended solutions based on industry best practises
Ability to provide technical governance across Cloudsense CPQ solutions at Telstra
Assess and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the Salesforce application solutions to ensure user requirements and business objectives are met in a timely and cost effective manner
Understand overall business operations and develops innovative solutions to help improve productivity
Ability to understand and design provisioning solutions at Telstra and how CRM interacts with provisioning layers.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills needed to support enterprise high availability Salesforce applications
Coordinate with technical resource within and outside of Customer Platforms team.
Monitor process of software configuration/development/testing to assure quality deliverable.
Ensure standards of QA are being met
Review deliverables to verify that they meet client and contract expectations; Implement and enforce high standards for quality deliverables
Analyses performance and capacity issues of the highest complexity with Salesforce application.
Demonstrate thought Leadership in Cloudsense CPQ innovations and practices.
Assists leadership with development and management of new application capabilities to improve productivity
Provide training and educate other team members around core capabilities and helps them deliver high quality solutions and deliverables/documentation
Self-Motivator to perform Design / Develop user requirements, test and deploy the changes into production
Skill & Experience : 12 + yrs
SFDC, APEX, Conga, Appttus, Cloudsense
Technical Descriptors
Salesforce – Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Force. Com platform
Salesforce Certified Developer / Advanced Developer / Technical Architect is essential
Experience in building applications on force.com platform with extensive hands-on and subject matter expertise in Salesforce technology including
Full cycle implementation experience with SFDC (application design, architecture and development using Salesforce.com)
Strong SFDC knowledge and Integration components for SFDC (SFDC APIs, Apex controllers, Apex Web Services, Apex callout, outbound messaging, SFDC data loaders, etc.)
Command over APEX and Visual force
Hands on experience in building salesforce apex classes, test classes and deployment process.
Deep knowledge of Salesforce API’s and hands on experience in building custom API’s and integration.
Working knowledge of web frameworks – HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JSON, Ajax
working knowledge of all Atlassian tools a bonus
Expertise in developing CPQ capability using Cloudsense.
Proven experience of working with Telco Clients to configure products, Baskets, Order Orchestration and Technical Enrichment.
Certifications in Appttus and Conga would be essential.
Expertise in developing Contract management solution integrating into CPQ using Conga or Appttus
Proven experience with creation of relevant documentation including, but not limited to Apttus CPQ solution design document and requirements documentation
Experience with migration of CPQ across environments including experience with the Apttus migration tool
Knowledge of the fundamental capabilities of Apttus CPQ including but not limited to:
Quoting and Quote Templates
Approvals (Deal Manager/IWA preferred)
X- Author
Fundamental understanding of Apttus CLM capabilities, Apttus CLM 201 certification a plus
Experience with Apttus Advanced Workflow Approvals
Experience with X-Author for Excel and Contracts
Experience with Apttus Wizard
Familiar with Apttus admin settings, Apttus custom settings and DocuSign settings.
Knowledge of Apttus development
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Software-Senior Engineer(Big Data Architect)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
This position offers diversity in projects, an opportunity to work in a team environment with autonomy and a high-level of responsibility. There are also excellent opportunities for professional growth and advancement within Telstra Customer Platforms and broader Telstra systems.
He would be responsible to develop, maintain, test and evaluate big data solutions within organisations and would be also involved in the design of big data solutions
He would builds large-scale data processing systems He would work on how algorithms work and have experience building high-performance algorithms.
The purpose of the role is to take responsibility for ensuring all requests from the business are developed and delivered in the most optimal way taking into consideration business roadmaps, ITS CRM Strategy, industry best practice, vendor roadmaps and thought leadership and innovation delivering a competitive advantage to Telstra

Understand overall business operations and develops innovative solutions to help improve productivity

Coordinate with technical resource within and outside of B2B Digitisation.

Provide training and educate other team members around core capabilities and helps them deliver high quality solutions and deliverables/documentation

Experience with Data Modelling Tool like Erwin/MagicDraw, Hadoop Monitoring services, Hadoop Architecture Understanding, Hadoop Installation/ Service Management, Cluster Management, Unix/Python Scripting,

Should be well versed with overall IT landscape, technologies and should be able to analyze how different technologies integrates with each other

Should be able to compare tools and technologies and recommend a tool or technology

Ability to work cross functionally to deliver appropriate resolution of technical, procedural, and operational issues.

Deep Knowledge of developing Machine Learning & Deep Learning Models
Good knowledge of NoSQL Databases/ HBase/ MongoDB

Title: Software-Senior Engineer(Salesforce Engineering Lead)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
Salesforce Engineering lead will work with business stakeholders and ITS colleagues in the implementation and support of CRM (Customer Relationship Management) at Telstra. This position offers diversity in projects, an opportunity to work in a team environment with autonomy and a high-level of responsibility. There are also excellent opportunities for professional growth and advancement within Telstra Customer Platforms and broader Telstra systems.

The purpose of the role is to take responsibility for ensuring all requests from the business are developed and delivered in the most optimal way taking into consideration business roadmaps, ITS CRM Strategy, industry best practice, vendor roadmaps and thought leadership and innovation delivering a competitive advantage to Telstra.

Title: Server Side Developers
Description:
At June Gaming, Our mission is to "Make Games that People Play for Years".

We got started with real time multiplayer games like MaskGun, Puzzle Clash, Ninja Fun Race, Tower Conquest and Road Riot.

Our most valuable asset is our People - We believe that the best Games are made by the best Teams.
Our people at June are passionate about Game making, are self motivated, persistent, ship regularly and work well in small teams.

Our games have been downloaded over 150 Million times, but we believe that we are just getting started.

For us to succeed in our mission to make Great games, we need a few more people.
Join us on our journey of our life time, by applying for a job.
We promise that these open positions are few and fill up quickly.

Job Description
As a Server Side Developer at June, you will be working on the heart of our RealTime Multiplayer Web Platform that powers millions of users in a realtime environment.
Where latencies are measured in milli seconds and downtime does not exists and scaling happens automatically.
If you like working on complex technical challenges in small teams, love technology and genuinely work proactively and autonomously, you will love working here.
You will be working in a small cross functional games team, helping with designing features, making decisions and solving complex scalable problems.
You should be a great communicator and enjoy working in a fast paced and Agile environment.

Our Games Teams share work and frameworks across projects.
If one game team creates something cool, we often use or repurpose that in another game.
Part of your role will be to effectively collaborate and share knowledge among the rest of the team.

This is a great opportunity to develop games with some incredibly passionate and creative people, so a passion for technology and games would be great.
If you want to join us to make great games on our cutting edge technology and truly make an impact, then we want to talk to you!

Job Responsibilities
Taking responsibility for server development in an agile team comprising front-end engineering, server engineering, devops, art, game design and QA engineering
Working with .NET/Java/Lua/Javascript, writing .NET Restful Services, various opensource frameworks, or using AWS SDK to develop game features, middleware services, common components and tools.
Taking part in all aspects of the sprint life-cycle, from feature design and planning through implementation, launch and live operations support.
Creating elegant, reusable code and unit tests.

You take pride in your work, and know what it means to take responsibility and deliver quality focused products.
You enjoy working in a dynamic and agile environment.

We offer you a chance to join a team of professionals, looking to iterate fast on a fun concept and then building it out where we believe that talent feeds talent.
We do not believe in bureaucracy, nor are there any solo artists at June.
We all work together to achieve the best results.
All of us have a genuine chance to contribute to the final product.
We believe in each other’s skills and value each other’s work.

Hands on architect and coder for sophisticated client/server systems for mobile gaming
Innovate and iterate on process, systems and technology to deliver world-class social games
Be a leader; Identify and articulate technical and production risks and obstacles, as well as generate solutions!

If these are values that you are passionate about, then you might just be the person we are looking for.

Job Requirements
Excellent server engineering skills in .NET/.NET Core/Java/JavaScript
Experience and/or a passion for functional programming
Experience working in a service based architecture
Experience working with NoSQL systems like MongoDB
Experience working with AWS / GCP / Azure Hosted Infrastructure
Experience working in a team building and supporting a product with a significant user base
Excellent communication skills and attitude
Ability to quickly get up to speed with existing code
Passion for games
Write maintainable and robust code in a popular object oriented language.
Solid familiarity with 3rd party SDKs, analytics, and A/B testing in mobile games
Familiarity with git, svn or other VCS.
Self starter, analytical and creative
Involvement in all areas of game development including Game Logic, Artificial Intelligence, writing Bots and User Interface.
Support and contribute new ideas to game design
Write robust code to be used by millions of users
Independently create complete games from scratch
Work as part of a team, but with plenty of opportunity to take responsibility on an individual level
Bonus Points
Having worked on a successful ( >1M MAU) free to play game
Proven effectiveness in directing or delivering production software for high quality games with at least one shipped game product of which you were a primary contributor (self published titles are acceptable).
Having designed and developed an AWS based architecture with 5-100 servers
Having built and launched a mobile game on iOS and Android
Having a working knowledge of React
Having a working knowledge of Unity3D
Open Source Contributor.

Title: Principal Engineer (Automation Framework, Artificial Intelli...
Description:
Job Title: Principal Engineer
Company Overview:
Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company — we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities.
Why Work For Us:
Dell is primed to recruit the best and brightest candidates from all across the globe. We take pride in fostering a winning, innovative, inclusive employee culture. We also take calculated risks and we celebrate big victories when they pay off.
Business Overview:
Providing timely and effective test planning, development and execution to support release of quality products into production. Enabling suppliers and ODM partners with Validation best practices. Developing and deploying a sustainable validation process for key technologies. Customer Validation Environments –Understood knowledge of our customer environments, workloads, deployment architectures and usage models. Collaboration with Development - To Implement Defect Detection & Prevention Methods. Industry Leading Efficiency - Scope, People, Lab. Standardized Test Practices and Measures – Through the use of industry TMMi L3 processes. Mature Automation Strategy - Automation Anytime, Anywhere, by Anyone™. Advanced Test Engineering – Simulation & statistical analysis.
Key responsibilities:
Work with a team of developers and testers in a highly agile environment to produce high quality software.
Proficient in identifying use cases and impact assessment by going through Behavioral Specifications & HLD for existing products.
Should understand the product architecture and assist test leads in deriving White box and Black box test strategy/coverage
Design and develop automation framework for product validation
Should be able to develop in house tools to ease the validation barriers. Also expect to demonstrate new ideas through prototypes/Proof of Concepts
Keeping up to date with emerging technologies (AI, ML, DL) and developments trends to assess impact of the projects
Should be able to conduct training/mentoring leads in the test group.
Participate and identify risk in every stage of the project (Design, develop, planning, test entry, exit etc.)
Responsible for test strategy, test coverage of the system management products. Should work across groups to drive efficiency by optimizing and eliminating redundancy in test cycles.
Detailed knowledge of the Agile Software Development Life Cycle and implementing agile principles.
Should represent and advocate validation group in all technical forums. Manages and communicate all relevant stake holders throughout all phases of a release.
Should be able to plan and implement change management for short and long term strategies such as retiring legacy systems, migrating to new systems without impacting productivity
Key skills required for role:
 Design and Architecture
 Programming
 Validation
 Communication Skills
 Presentation Skills
 Influencing Skills
Requirements:
Should possess Masters/PHD in computer science with minimum of 10+ years of experience
Should possess minimum 5 years of experience in NMS domain for system management products.
Experience in designing and developing tools or test automation frameworks using Java, C++ or Python technologies.
Should have good understanding of White Box testing concepts and best practices
Should have strong understanding of OOPs, SDLC, STLC
Proficient in C++, Python or Java, with a good knowledge of its ecosystems (IDEs and Frameworks)
Experience in implementing, consuming and testing Web services SOAP and Rest APIs would be an added advantage.
Experience in testing NMS products would be an added advantage.
Understanding of Server/Storage hardware and its components
Understanding of embedded software/firmwares, drivers, etc
Knowledge of various protocols like WSMAN, WMI, Redfish, SNMP, SSH, etc
Experience on developing complex GUI/API/CLI based automation frameworks using tools/technologies/products like Selenium, Protractor , TestNG, STAF, Python, PERL, C, C#, Java or similar
Exposure to cloud computing, containerization, ML, AI and allied technologies would be an added advantage.
Having exposure to plugin architecture framework is an added advantage.
Having exposure to predictive QA/ Artificial Intelligence /Machine learning is an advantage.
Should have an employed technologies such as simulation, emulators in their testing.
Experience working in an Agile, DevOps model with exposure to ALM/CI tools like Jenkins, Dockers, Maven, Gradle, ANT, JIRA, etc and its use for driving continuous testing of the products.
Benefits:
We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities — all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.
Our EVP:
Our Culture Code unites us and makes us a great family of companies and a great place to work. It’s how we run the business, go to market, work together and provide inspirational leadership.
Our culture code is defined by our values and are made real every day by defining expectations for how we work and how we lead.
Apply now!
Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Software Engineer
(Job Number: 1904139)
The Purpose of This Role
This is purely a hands on role where you need engage in developing solutions in latest technologies, lead the code reviews and coding standards for newer projects.
The Value You Deliver
Below are few of the primary areas that you will be required to contribute as an Architect –
Working closely with architects in FICOT (U.S) and with the architecture group so set the future direction for our applications.
Must be completely hands on in Java programming language and it related ecosystem. Should have a very good understanding of Java related programming language.
Should be aware of functional programming concepts.
AWS implementation along with database migration on PostgreSQL, MySQL and Oracle. Cloud services evaluation for ETL, Application health monitoring, logging, etc.
Container deployment model such as…EC2, EKS and PCF.
Data encryption techniques (At rest and in-transit)
Kafka implementation with confluent for the event steaming platform
Moving all our 40+ applications to Devops with CICD implementation and also implementing various other tools in pipeline to get maximum efficiency.
Implementation of stage 2 of Artificial Intelligence in operational chatbot using either of these (Python NLTK , AWS Lex Bot , Azure Bot service).
Feasibility of using open source tools like KNIME or Apache NIFI for ETL processing against the licensed Informatica tool.
Micro analysis of all the existing set of legacy applications and set a directions for each of them to move them to the latest tech stack which can be more efficient and maintainable.
To help FICOT team in keeping pace with the WS direction of moving everything to cloud in next 3-4 years. It will involve the following
Evaluating the best cloud platforms (as of now AWS and Azure) and Google next year for our applications.
Building strategy and architecture by working closely with Enterprise Cloud Committee (ECC) for each application
Deciding the right set of Cloud services and Data migration services for moving the existing applications to cloud
Security considerations as per the recommendations from ECC for all the components moving to cloud.
Helping the teams in setting up coding standards along with best practices for backend and frontend technologies.
Mentoring the team members in thinking holistically while starting with the development which helps in getting more efficient solutions.
Evaluate and recommend technology and frameworks for flexibility, long-term viability, and time to market.
The Skills that are Key to this role
Technical / Behavioral
Experience and knowledge of HTML 5, JavaScript, CSS3 , Ajax, JQuery, HTML5, Angular
Application development using Java EE, Spring framework
Experience / exposure of hosting the application on to public cloud (Data, service and UI).
Exposure to container deployment models & CI-CD for cloud applications.
Understanding of and experience with Micro-Services Architecture concepts and emerging patterns such as APIs, JAX-RS, REST/JSON.
Relational databases like Oracle & DB2.
Event driver transaction processing using EAI, ESB and messaging patterns using technologies such as WSO2, ActiveMQ, Tomcat etc.
Experience with API Manager tools such as WSO2 preferred (API gateway).
Security integration using oAuth and LDAP.
Good working experience on GIT, Maven, Jenkins, uDeploy, JIRA, Artifactory, Dynatrace, Sonar is must.
The Skills that are Good To Have for this role
Business Process Management and workflow system like IBM BPM.
Business Rules management system such as ODM/Drools etc.
Working knowledge of external cloud AWS, Azure etc. Any certification is an added advantage.
Complex event processing and distributed caching.
Knowledge of responsive web design and technologies.
Knowledge of continuous integration, static code analysis and test driven development.
Knowledge of internet security and OAuth, Open ID Connect etc. knowledge and best practices.
Experience on performance analysis and tuning.
Knowledge of client side and mobile technologies: Node, Handlebars and Cordova a plus
Knowledge of No Sql Database MongoDb, Cassandra etc.
Knowledge of QA Automation tools like Selenium, Cucumber etc. .
Knowledge on Document based database systems (MongoDB, DynamoDB, etc..)
Knowledge on Agile practices
How Your Work Impacts the Organization
Workplace Solutions (WS) helps millions of people save and invest through workplace savings plans. WS builds lifetime relationships with customers and provides employers with cost-effective, integrated employee benefit solutions. The company serves customers online, over the phone. WS business constitutes of 5 different product lines Defined Contribution (DC), Defined Benefits(DB), Health & Welfare(HW), Stock plan and Plan sponsor services(SPS)
The Financial and Operations development team (FIOT) is part of the Workplace Solutions (WS) Technology group. Our team is responsible for new and enhanced design and development of application areas across WS. We have close to 40 + applications that we deal with currently.
The Expertise we’re looking for
Bachelor’s degree in Computer science or any other discipline
Demonstrated mastery of previous level skills and responsibilities of relevant job family
10+ years of experience in web technology role
AWS certification is great value add
Fidelity Investments is one of the world's largest providers of financial services. Headquartered in Boston, US, Fidelity's goal is to make financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. Privately held for nearly 70 years, Fidelity employs 45,000 associates who are focused on the long-term success of our customers. FMR (Fidelity Management & Research) India is the Global In-house Center of Fidelity Investments. Headquartered at Bangalore, where operations commenced in 2003, FMR India has another fully-functional unit at Chennai. To know more visit: FMR India
Location: Bangalore - Manyata/EGL / Chennai
Shift timings: 2:00 pm - 4:00pm

Title: Network Software Engineer
Description:
Job Description
Debugs software products through the use of systematic tests to develop, apply, and maintain quality standards for company products. Develops, modifies, and executes software test plans. Analyzes and writes test standards and procedures. Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software. Analyzes test results to ensure correct functionality, determine root causes of failures and recommends corrective action. Consults with development engineers in resolution of problems.

Qualifications

Experience : 8 to 10 years

Qualification : B.E./B.Tech/M.E./M.Tech/MCA

Must have skills:
Experience in validating networking software components for high performance devices such as base-stations, switches, routers, gateways or firewalls
Experience in validating data plane and control plane network software stack
Proficient in atleast two protocols/technologies : TCP, IPv4, IPv6, IPSec, QoS, Vlan, Ethernet Switching, IP Routing
- Proficient in at least one of the scripting languages- Python, TCL/Expect
Good knowledge of C programming
Working knowledge of the linux operating-system
Experience with traffic generators such as Ixia & Scappy
Experience in analyzing packet captures with tools such as Wireshark

Nice to have:
Exposure to testing in multi-core environment
Background in testing of TCP/IP protocol stack
Exposure to socket programming
Background in C API unit testing
Familiarity with source code control system such as GIT
Inside this Business Group
The Data Center Group (DCG) is at the heart of Intel’s transformation from a PC company to a company that runs the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing devices. The data center is the underpinning for every data-driven service, from artificial intelligence to 5G to high-performance computing, and DCG delivers the products and technologies—spanning software, processors, storage, I/O, and networking solutions—that fuel cloud, communications, enterprise, and government data centers around the world.

Legal Disclaimer:
Intel prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

Hiring at Intel is based purely on merit and Intel does not ask or require candidates to deposit any money. Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
About Microsoft AI & Research Org

AI & Research is a new group formed at Microsoft solving to accelerate our innovation in AI, and to enable Microsoft to create truly intelligent systems and products for our customers.
When we launched Bing on June 1st of 2009, we changed search forever and created a foundational technology for AI. Bing’s market share has grown incredibly since the launch, and we serve over a third of U.S. queries, and power the partners Yahoo, Apple, Amazon and AOL for search.

Our investments in ML and AI technologies in Bing have been heavily leveraged throughout the company from Azure taking advantage of AutoPilot, Cosmos and the Edge, to our new investments in Conversation-as-a-Platform (CaaP) where we are leading the industry.

The largest example of using the Bing technologies was the creation of Cortana – our personal digital assistant, who has answered 12 billion questions for 130 million users. Cortana got us into the digital agent game. Watch this Satya's Ignite keynote on how we’re democratizing AI using Cortana.

Harry Shum is the Executive Vice President of Artificial Intelligence & Research at Microsoft. Here is his vision on AI. Video.

Responsibilities
What is in it for you?

Are you excited about building world-class software, working on data/algorithms, learning, having fun and maintaining work-life balance?

In your journey with Microsoft, you will be applying your computer science skills to innovate, design and implement solutions for cutting edge web scale problems. You will also get an opportunity to work on Big Data and employ ML techniques in search space.

Our team comprises of highly motivated researchers, engineers, product managers and data-scientists building end-to-end web-scale and enterprise-scale AI systems. Together we develop and deliver robust, state of art and scalable solutions across a rich set of scenarios.

We are hiring talented, energetic, creative and passionate software engineers with experience in shipping/building high-quality software products/services.

Roles & Responsibilities

Design, develop, test, deploy scalable intelligent services
Analyze risks and compromises with various design choices
Collaborate with Partners and address customer needs
Qualifications
BS/MS degree in Computer Science or related quantitative field with 6+ years of relevant experience
Strong software design and coding skills
Experience in developing distributed and large scale infrastructure components
Experience with recommendation systems, text processing systems, ranking systems, speech recognition systems or similar machine learning systems, a plus
Passion for new technologies, quality, and customer satisfaction
Excellent communication and collaboration skills

At Microsoft, we believe in not only working/building careers but also giving a life experience. Vidya Srinivisan has shared one of her such experience here.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

Title: Software Engineering Manager, Google Home and Nest
Description:
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of relevant work experience, including experience in technical leadership and people management, or 5 years of relevant work experience in addition to a PhD in Computer Science or a related technical field.
Experience in software development using one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to C/C++, Java, Python, JavaScript, C#, Go, Objective-C, and/or Swift.
Experience working with two or more from the following: web or mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, embedded systems, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development.

Preferred qualifications:
Master’s degree or PhD degree in Engineering, Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with Wifi, embedded systems, IOT, cloud infrastructure, device and network management, and large scale system design.
Experience recruiting, building, and managing large software engineering teams in offshore locations.
Ability to share knowledge via formal mentoring, reviewing code, reviewing design documents, giving technical talks, teaching classes, or as a consultant on projects.
About the job
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
The Google Home and Nest Software Engineering team is responsible for building and launching Google Home and Nest devices such as the Nest Thermostat, Nest Camera, Google Home, Chromecast, Google Wifi, and Google Home Hub Display products. We work on all the Embedded Software, Backend Cloud Services, Frontend Cloud Services, Applications, and Support Tools that enable these devices to provide delightful user experiences in line with our mission of building a thoughtful home.
As a Software Engineering Manager, you will focus on IOT, device management services, identity and household authentication models, family friendly Wifi, home automation, contextual intelligence, voice casting, voice assistant services, machine learning, and more.
Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
Responsibilities
Build a team and cultivate a culture of innovation.
Manage a team of software engineers and technical leads, including task planning, code reviews, and software launch and release processes.
Drive technical projects and provide leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
Be responsible for the overall planning, execution, and success of complex technical projects.
Contribute technically to projects. Work closely with product management team to ensure we're building the best products.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Title: Senior Lead - Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Lead - Data Scientist
(Job Number: 1905160)
Grade - 05
Job Title – Lead Data Scientist

The Purpose of This Role
This role involves working with senior stakeholders in understanding and identifying the business requirements and needs in the areas of Big Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence. Scanning the fast paced external and internal environments in these areas, developing futuristic ideas that would benefit the firm and leading implementation of mathematical/AI models/algorithms/solutions to bring those ideas to life. Specific experience in AI areas like deep learning, genetic algorithms will be an advantage.
Individual in this role is expected to work with multiple stakeholders and teams, have excellent knowledge and experience of recent developments and work in a self-directed manner in ambiguously defined need areas.
The Value You Deliver
Improve customer experience, top line and bottom line of the business by identifying growth and efficiency opportunities
Analyze structured and unstructured data using data mining/statistical/machine learning/deep learning tools, Data visualization, Digital/ Web analytics tools and techniques and story telling.
Managing business partner / stakeholder engagement
Participating in / leading interactions with middle and senior level management
The Skills that are Key to this role
Technical / Behavioral
Expertise in Machine Learning models:
Independently reason and understand models in general from and probabilistic perspective
Expert in handling various data types and structures: structured, unstructured, voice, static versus streaming data. Extensive prior experience in integrating data
Possess extensive knowledge of and experience in applying data mining and machine learning, deep learning and Reinforcement learning techniques in a professional context
Should have extensive experience with relational, NO-SQL and Graph databases
Interpret, criticize, and debug neural networks (not just implement and evaluate accuracy)
Expertise with Bayesian probabilistic modeling, familiar with probabilistic programming (e.g. Stan)
Experience with Generative neural networks such as VAEs
Proficiency in the entire Data Modeling life cycle – From exploratory data analysis to data cleaning to Feature Engineering to Model Building and Validation.
Comfort with Tensorflow and PyTorch and associated tooling
Exposure to natural language processing and associated tooling (Spacy, NLTK- Natural Language Toolkit)
Familiarity with foundational model reasoning: bias-variance tradeoff, shrinkage/partial pooling
Able to independently research and apply state-of-the-art deep learning and Bayesian modeling literature
Communicate design decisions, tradeoffs, and findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders

Additional Skills for Model Building
Expert in Python Programming preferably functional programming
Experience in Building models in AWS environment
Comfort with Git source control and repo-driven development - continuous integration / continuous deployment
Able to organize code using functional programming concepts, experience with statically typed functional programming a plus
Comfortable working with data platforms independently – able to write REST clients, SQL, PySpark, as needed.
Exposure to containerization/Docker
The Skills that are Good To Have for this role
Familiarity with Kubernetes and exposure to Kubeflow
Expertise in natural language processing
Experience with Gaussian process models
Advanced theory - optimization, differential geometry, statistical physics, category theory
Advanced functional programming languages - Haskell, Idris and exposure to declarative programming concepts
How Your Work Impacts the Organization
Established in 2006 in India, BA&R is focused on providing customized knowledge services across Fidelity businesses. Key competencies in BA&R include Investment Research, Primary & Secondary Research, Data Modeling, Data Science, AI, Operational Analytics, Digital Analytics, Data Visualization, Campaign Management etc. This position is part of the AI PI COE and Data Science team for Customer Knowledge and Strategic Insights organization.
The Expertise We’re Looking For
4+ years of relevant experience with organizations known for cutting edge/ best-in-class applications of Advanced Analytics, Predictive Modeling and Artificial Intelligence.
Master’s Degree / PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Operations Research)
Company Overview

Fidelity Investments is one of the world's largest providers of financial services. Headquartered in Boston, US, Fidelity's goal is to make financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. Privately held for nearly 70 years, Fidelity employs 45,000 associates who are focused on the long-term success of our customers. FMR (Fidelity Management & Research) India is the Global In-house Center of Fidelity Investments. Headquartered at Bangalore, where operations commenced in 2003, FMR India has another fully-functional unit at Chennai. To know more visit : FMR India

Location : Bangalore - EGL
Shift timings: 11:00 AM - 8:00PM


Business Analysis/Project Management
Primary LocationIN-KRN-Bangalore
Job LevelIndividual Contributor
Education LevelBachelor's Degree (±16 years)
FMR India Business UnitBusiness Analytics & Research
OrganizationIndia BG
