Title: Java Full Stack Developer / Core Java / HTML / Java Script /...
Description:
Requisition ID: 218729
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
JOB TITLE: Developer - Cloud HCM Analytics Team
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES:
At SAP SuccessFactors we have started a Human Revolution. Using the latest technology, we are unlocking human potential and transforming our customer’s workforces in ways they never imagined. We are digitally transforming their businesses into the next generation of intelligent enterprises. Because people are at the heart of every business transformation and people are the heart of our business. The SAP SuccessFactors product suite spans core human resources and payroll, analytics-based hiring and customized onboarding, continuous performance management, intelligent succession and more. We operate the largest HCM Cloud in the world, supporting over 120 million users with over a billion transactions for customers across 26 industries in over 90 countries. Our co-located agile teams have end-to-end ownership of product, design, development, release, user assistance, and cloud operations capabilities. We are looking for the best talent to join our team and deliver continuous innovations in the cloud while bringing purpose to their lives and more meaning to their work. Join us today and become a part of the Human Revolution.
ABOUT THE TEAM
The Cloud HCM Analytics team builds the analytics solution on top of world’s biggest cloud-based enterprise application which has unique challenge in building a common solution that should be customizable for more than 4,450 across 60 industries in over 177 countries and scalable for 50 million users usage. We are responsible for building operational reporting solutions, as well as cutting edge analytical solutions. This team provides ample opportunities to interact with various stake holders and come of the best solution and implement the same with support for highly customizable and scalable approach. Current development activities involved in make use of Predictive Analytics, Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence. We have ambitious road map to start working on Prescriptive analytics.
Position Overview
Developers should be able to work as a Full stack developer with specialized either in UI or back end. Design highly scalable and performant solution which address functional as well as nonfunctional requirement with high quality.
Full stack developer – willing and capable of handling both client and server development
End to end responsibility – take care of your feature from requirements to deployment
Collaborate well – demonstrate excellent development practices, share and motivate others.
This development role provides immense potential for growth. The potential candidate would work closely with other members of the team and other functional groups within SAP SuccessFactors
SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Strong technical skills with technologies like Java/J2EE, Hibernate, Spring, SAP HANA, UI Technologies and OData protocols to develop modem cutting edge software that performs and scales in cloud environment
Server oriented - Knowledge in Java backend development (tomcat, JEE, dependency injection, and more) – mandatory
At least basic client-side knowledge of Web technologies, JS, HTML, CSS – mandatory.
Sound knowledge in Object Oriented Programming Principles, Design Patterns and Software Architecture, especially in new age Cloud solutions
Must be able to design and implement across all layers of the software (UI, Backend, Database)
Exposure to debugging, troubleshooting and performance tuning for complex SQL queries
Knowledge of lean development infrastructure process including Git, TeamCity, Jenkins etc. and exposure to Continuous Delivery practices
Exposure to building Analytical and report modelling for highly customizable Enterprise cloud-based SaaS application
Working knowledge of Scrum, Test Driven Development and passionate about unit test, integrity testing, stress testing and performance testing and test automation
Exposure to building large scale application deployed on public cloud like AWS, AZURE etc ..
EDUCATION, WORK EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS
BE/B.Tech, ME/M.Tech, MCA with 60% aggregate across.
Strong educational qualifications (Engineering majors, MCA from reputed institutes)
4-8 years of professional experience in developing Java/J2EE based enterprise web-based application,
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Bachelor’s in Computer Science required, Master preferred.
#SAPSFSF
WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
Additional Locations:

Title: Senior Automation QA Engineer (Remote/Work-from-home)
Description:
WalletHub is one of the leading personal finance destinations in the US and rapidly growing. We’re looking for a motivated, hardworking, and competitive Senior Automation QA Engineer for a full-time, permanent position.
The expected work schedule is 7 AM to 7 PM EST Monday to Friday, including a 1h break.
Responsibilities
Testing and assuring high quality performance of website
Reporting and validating bugs for all components
Creating test plans and test cases
Creating and maintaining automated tests using Selenium and Java
Identifying opportunities for improvement and making constructive suggestions for change
Qualifications
You are the ideal candidate for this job if you have:
At least 3 years of hands-on experience in Test Automation with Java and Selenium
At least 4 years experience in Manual Testing
Excellent attention to details
Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Willingness to work hard
Proficient in written/spoken English
Compensation
Very competitive salary based on prior experience and qualifications
Potential for stock options after the first year
Raise and advancement opportunities based on periodic evaluations
The ability to work overtime for added income
100% remote position
Visa sponsorship (after 24 months with the company, based on performance, in case you will be working from outside the US)
How to apply
To get our attention, all you need to do is apply on Indeed and include your updated resume as well as a brief message telling us why you are the right candidate.If we believe that you will be a good match, we'll contact you to arrange the next steps of the application process.
Please know that we appreciate your interest in our company but due to the high number of applications we are unable to get back to candidates who have not been selected to move forward.
Note
This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed remotely from outside the U.S. without the need for U.S. work authorization.
More about WalletHub
WalletHub is a high-growth fintech company based in Washington, D.C. that is looking for talented, hard-working individuals to help us reshape personal finance. More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:
1) Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.
2) Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.
3) Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.
In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹960,000.00 to ₹2,100,000.00 /year

Title: Git + AWS Cloud Engineer
Description:
Klizo Solutions develops mobile apps, websites, and software. We work in some really cool technology like facial recognition, artificial intelligence, and even blockchain. We have about 25 people in the team, and we are are doubling in size over the next couple months. We are looking for good people to join our rapidly growing company.
As a key member of our team, the AWS Cloud Engineer will work with development teams and other DevOps engineers to solve critical issues while improving customer experience. Other responsibilities include:
Build and support scalable microservices and system orchestration.
Design, development, and testing of features delivered as applications and/or services.
Investigate and contribute to solving issues in production environments.
Provide collaborative conduit between various technical and non-technical teams.
Build effective monitoring, alerts, and metrics for production services.
Build effective DevOps services, processes, and tooling.
Supporting applications and/or services as and when required on a 24x7 basis.
Desired Qualifications

Minimum of 7 years of software engineering experience

AWS Certified Developer highly desired

'Make-it-happen' attitude, the innate capacity for ownership and timely delivery of results in a fast-paced environment

Experience with AWS DevOps tooling such as CodeStar and Service Application Model (SAM)
Experience with infrastructure as code tools and methods such as Chef, Puppet, Salt, Cloud Formation, or Ansible

Experience with HTTP APIs and RESTful web services
Understanding of web browser APIs and behavior
Excellent technical communication skills
Competent in designing and building web applications and/or web services in a commercial setting
Competent in design/implementation for reliability, availability, scalability and performance
Competent in software engineering tools (e.g. build tools) and best practices (e.g. test automation and continuous integration)

Experience with automated testing, test-driven development and/or behavior-driven development
Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers
Meticulous attention to detail
Ability to multi-task while ensuring high quality of results

Title: Software-Senior Engineer(DEVOPS Product owner)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Role with us:
To create a brilliant connected future for everybody through the delivery of high quality software solutions.
Successful candidates will be experienced Senior Technology Specialists possessing strong problem solving skills, a self-starter mindset with a proactive attitude towards delivery and leadership capabilities in order to provide technical guidance to other Software Engineers.
Technical Product owner is responsible for laying out vision for implementing DEVOPS i..e CI/CD, Automation Testing, TDD, Monitoring across SaaS and IaaS platforms on AWS and Azure
Key Accountabilities:
Technical Product Owner would be responsible for laying out the vision and blueprints and bring it to reality with a DevSecOps view.
Identify industry best practices and standards for implementation of Cloud.
Guide engineers and developers in following best practices and standards and cross train them on cloud technology.
Complying with all relevant processes and standards, including change management principles and processes to ensure deliverables meet or exceed defined quality standards.
Skill & Experience: 12 + yrs Exp
DEVOPS, CI/CD, Agile, Bamboo, Jenkins, AWS, Azzure, Git, Bitbucket, Docker, Virtualisation, Monitoring, Teraform, Product Management, Agile
Optional Skills: Chef, Ansible, Python, Database, Perl, UNIX
Technical Descriptors
7+ years of experience with AWS Cloud with understanding of AWS platform, service offerings and billing.
AWS CloudFormation templates, AWS EC2, VPC and Subnets, S3, ELB/ALB.
Experience in high level design and architectures of networks, servers, infrastructure and other systems for various models such as IaaS, SaaS, PaaS etc.
Experience with setup and administration of databases in AWS (MongoDB, SQL Server, Couchbase databases etc.)
Working experience in a DevOps environment with the team and other stakeholders.
Understanding of Agile, DevOps
Understanding of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and ability to develop and contribute in an IaC environment.
Exposure to and ability to support automation pipeline (Bamboo, Jenkins, etc.)
Have working knowledge on tools such as Jira/Confluence/BitBucket/Git.
Understanding and hands on experience with VMs and Dockers
Certification(s) in AWS
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Software-Senior Engineer(CPQ Architect)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
CPQ Technical Architect will work with business stakeholders and ITS colleagues in the implementation and support of Cloudsense CPQ at Telstra. This position offers diversity in projects, an opportunity to work in a team environment with autonomy and a high-level of responsibility. There are also excellent opportunities for professional growth and advancement within Telstra Customer Platforms and broader Telstra systems.
CPQ Technical Architect is responsible for leading technical CPQ low level architecture activities for Telstra across requirement analysis, design, development and implementation on Telstra’s key CRM platforms. They will be responsible for developing and coordinating technical delivery aspects of all Telstra’s CRM systems implementations, communicating effectively and fostering strong relationships with business users and stakeholders.
The purpose of the role is to take responsibility for ensuring all requests from the business are developed and delivered in the most optimal way taking into consideration business roadmaps, ITS CRM Strategy, industry best practice, vendor roadmaps and thought leadership and innovation delivering a competitive advantage to Telstra.
He will participate in and/or be responsible for technical analysis of functional designs, preparation of technical designs, technical build & implementation of CRM, CRM configuration and scripting, quality & code reviews, facilitating testing, resolution of defects identified during test, managing relationships between support and development team, mentoring and training
Key Accountabilities
Salesforce Technical Architect role is to plan, coordinate, and execute all activities related to the requirements interpretation, design and implementation of CPQ, CLM applications. This individual will apply proven industry and technology experience as well as communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to issues related to design, development, and deployment of mission-critical CRM systems with a focus on quality application development and delivery.
This role is key to the success of the Customer Platforms function at Telstra and will be responsible and accountable for the following:
Ability to design and develop Salesforce CRM, Cloudsense CPQ & Force.com Applications
Ability to review vendor designs and recommended solutions based on industry best practises
Ability to provide technical governance across Cloudsense CPQ solutions at Telstra
Assess and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the Salesforce application solutions to ensure user requirements and business objectives are met in a timely and cost effective manner
Understand overall business operations and develops innovative solutions to help improve productivity
Ability to understand and design provisioning solutions at Telstra and how CRM interacts with provisioning layers.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills needed to support enterprise high availability Salesforce applications
Coordinate with technical resource within and outside of Customer Platforms team.

Title: Web Development Internship

SmartDocs is a global innovator in artificial intelligence (AI)-based enterprise chatbots, business process management (BPM), and enterprise content management (ECM) software. With deep integration to the SAP ERP application, SmartDocs products enable customers to quickly innovate, streamline, and realize digital transformation without significant investment in new hardware or software stacks. SmartDocs provides several comprehensive business solutions to address most areas of any organization, including finance, procurement, HR, and sales, that work side by side with SAP ERP and SAP Success Factors solutions. SmartDocs software is available both as cloud-based and on-premise deployment models.

Develop new efficient features and optimize the existing one 3. Work on team management, excellent interpersonal, communication, and effective organizational skills and solid technical skills 4. Title: Architect
Description:
Aspect employs a team of passionate individuals who are changing the face of customer engagement. Over our 40-year history we have empowered employees by creating an inspired community that values customer obsession, unlocked communications and relentless innovation. Our ability to think big has enabled us to continually evolve and lead the market, and to stay on the forefront with exciting technologies including cloud, mobile and artificial intelligence.

Job Description
As a key architectural resource for multiple product components or an entire product, the Cloud Architect is responsible for the architecture and deployment models, including system resources, 3rd party integrations and performance characteristics. The Cloud Architect has a complete understanding of the technologies used within the components, how the product interacts with other products and between internal components. Focuses on areas within the components needing improvement and is the lead resource for critical defect support during customer escalations involving environmental or integration areas.
PRIMARY ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES
Conceptualize and design next generation data center virtual infrastructure, server, networks, storage (SAN/NAS), Cloud, and Security.
Understand, recommend and guide improvements across the infrastructure service layers of the network, storage, servers, virtualization, to include operating and other systems.
Work with other Aspect Cloud Operations teams to establish and ensure adherence to software configuration best practices
Participate in security compliance efforts (e.g., PCI-DSS, ISO27001, SOX2)
Conduct research into a wide range of computing issues as required
Participate in analysis of technology vendors, including risk assessment due diligence
Identify security issues and risks, and develop mitigation plans
Develop architecture roadmaps for respective application, infrastructure, network and data domains
Identify architecture gaps and inefficiencies and provide recommendations for improvements and alignment

Qualifications
Required
Minimum 10 years’ experience as an architect working on both Linux-based and MS Windows-based system platforms
Strong aptitude for analytical problem solving.
Thorough understanding of enterprise, network, system and application level security issues.
Understanding of enterprise computing environments, and distributed applications
Thorough understanding of TCP/IP networks
Understanding of the system hardening processes, tools, guidelines and benchmarks.
Experience with security engineering, system and network security, authentication, security protocols, and application security
Development experience with 2 or more programming languages
Experience with at least 2 scripting languages such as Bash, Ruby, JavaScript, Perl or python
Working knowledge of a range of diagnostic utilities
Experience with Microsoft specific technologies such as DHCP server, RemoteApps and distributed remote desktop, IIS, Exchange, SQL server, Windows Server management tools.
Operational knowledge of Active Directory including designing forests, group policies, federation and one-way trusts.
Operational knowledge of Linux distributions such as Ubuntu, CentOS, and Debian
Operational knowledge of Linux technology such as bind, bash, iptables, and systems
General knowledge of certificate management systems
Experience with at least one virtualization technology such as VMWare, Open stack, or Hyper-V
Experience working with cloud providers such as Amazon AWS, Rackspace, Microsoft Azure as well as the services they provide for Orchestration, Logging, Monitoring, and File Storage
Operational knowledge for one of; IIS, NGINX, Apache HTTP Server, Tomcat, or Ruby on Rails
Knowledge of RDBMSs such as SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, and DB2
Experience with chef, puppet, kickstart, terraform, ansible, run deck, cloud formation; Chef preferred
Knowledge of network and web related protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, UDP, IPSEC, HTTP, HTTPS, routing protocols)
Bachelors’ degree in a technical, engineering or related discipline
Exceptional written and oral communication skills
Ability to absorb and retain information quickly
Ability to present technical ideas to a non-technical audience
Highly self-motivated and directed
Keen attention to detail
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a dynamic and fast paced environment
Exceptional customer service orientation
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Have a strong desire to learn continually and grow professionally
Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on rapport-building, listening, and collaboration
Strong written communication, with experience producing internal documentation

Preferred
Operational knowledge of at least one of; PCI-DSS, ISO27001, or SOX2
Telephony experience such as TDM or VOIP
Networking experience with Juniper and Cisco Routers and Firewalls
Networking routing experience with BGP and OSPF
Experience with IPv6 and related tunneling protocols such as 6to4, teredo, and 6rd
Experience integrating Windows services with Unix/Linux environments
Operational knowledge of creating and maintaining DNS zones in either Windows DNS or bind
General and operational knowledge of SAN and NAS, as well as network file systems such as NFS, SMB, ZFS, GlusterFS
Experience with setting up and configuring VPN, such as PPTP, L2TP, IPSec VPN, and GRE tunnels
LI-KM1

Aspect is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer with a strong commitment to diversity. In that spirit, we are particularly interested in receiving applications from a broad spectrum of people, including women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, veterans or any other legally protected group.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Software Engineer
(Job Number: 1904139)
The Purpose of This Role
This is purely a hands on role where you need engage in developing solutions in latest technologies, lead the code reviews and coding standards for newer projects.
The Value You Deliver
Below are few of the primary areas that you will be required to contribute as an Architect –
Working closely with architects in FICOT (U.S) and with the architecture group so set the future direction for our applications.
Must be completely hands on in Java programming language and it related ecosystem. Should have a very good understanding of Java related programming language.
Should be aware of functional programming concepts.
AWS implementation along with database migration on PostgreSQL, MySQL and Oracle. Cloud services evaluation for ETL, Application health monitoring, logging, etc.
Container deployment model such as…EC2, EKS and PCF.
Data encryption techniques (At rest and in-transit)
Kafka implementation with confluent for the event steaming platform
Moving all our 40+ applications to Devops with CICD implementation and also implementing various other tools in pipeline to get maximum efficiency.
Implementation of stage 2 of Artificial Intelligence in operational chatbot using either of these (Python NLTK , AWS Lex Bot , Azure Bot service).
Feasibility of using open source tools like KNIME or Apache NIFI for ETL processing against the licensed Informatica tool.
Micro analysis of all the existing set of legacy applications and set a directions for each of them to move them to the latest tech stack which can be more efficient and maintainable.
To help FICOT team in keeping pace with the WS direction of moving everything to cloud in next 3-4 years. It will involve the following
Evaluating the best cloud platforms (as of now AWS and Azure) and Google next year for our applications.
Building strategy and architecture by working closely with Enterprise Cloud Committee (ECC) for each application
Deciding the right set of Cloud services and Data migration services for moving the existing applications to cloud
Security considerations as per the recommendations from ECC for all the components moving to cloud.
Helping the teams in setting up coding standards along with best practices for backend and frontend technologies.
Mentoring the team members in thinking holistically while starting with the development which helps in getting more efficient solutions.
Evaluate and recommend technology and frameworks for flexibility, long-term viability, and time to market.
The Skills that are Key to this role
Technical / Behavioral
Experience and knowledge of HTML 5, JavaScript, CSS3 , Ajax, JQuery, HTML5, Angular
Application development using Java EE, Spring framework
Experience / exposure of hosting the application on to public cloud (Data, service and UI).
Exposure to container deployment models & CI-CD for cloud applications.
Understanding of and experience with Micro-Services Architecture concepts and emerging patterns such as APIs, JAX-RS, REST/JSON.
Relational databases like Oracle & DB2.
Event driver transaction processing using EAI, ESB and messaging patterns using technologies such as WSO2, ActiveMQ, Tomcat etc.
Experience with API Manager tools such as WSO2 preferred (API gateway).
Security integration using oAuth and LDAP.
Good working experience on GIT, Maven, Jenkins, uDeploy, JIRA, Artifactory, Dynatrace, Sonar is must.
The Skills that are Good To Have for this role
Business Process Management and workflow system like IBM BPM.
Business Rules management system such as ODM/Drools etc.
Working knowledge of external cloud AWS, Azure etc. Any certification is an added advantage.
Complex event processing and distributed caching.
Knowledge of responsive web design and technologies.
Knowledge of continuous integration, static code analysis and test driven development.
Knowledge of internet security and OAuth, Open ID Connect etc. knowledge and best practices.
Experience on performance analysis and tuning.
Knowledge of client side and mobile technologies: Node, Handlebars and Cordova a plus
Knowledge of No Sql Database MongoDb, Cassandra etc.
Knowledge of QA Automation tools like Selenium, Cucumber etc. .
Knowledge on Document based database systems (MongoDB, DynamoDB, etc..)
Knowledge on Agile practices
How Your Work Impacts the Organization
Workplace Solutions (WS) helps millions of people save and invest through workplace savings plans. WS builds lifetime relationships with customers and provides employers with cost-effective, integrated employee benefit solutions. The company serves customers online, over the phone. WS business constitutes of 5 different product lines Defined Contribution (DC), Defined Benefits(DB), Health & Welfare(HW), Stock plan and Plan sponsor services(SPS)
The Financial and Operations development team (FIOT) is part of the Workplace Solutions (WS) Technology group. Our team is responsible for new and enhanced design and development of application areas across WS. We have close to 40 + applications that we deal with currently.
The Expertise we’re looking for
Bachelor’s degree in Computer science or any other discipline
Demonstrated mastery of previous level skills and responsibilities of relevant job family
10+ years of experience in web technology role
AWS certification is great value add
Fidelity Investments is one of the world's largest providers of financial services. Headquartered in Boston, US, Fidelity's goal is to make financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. Privately held for nearly 70 years, Fidelity employs 45,000 associates who are focused on the long-term success of our customers. FMR (Fidelity Management & Research) India is the Global In-house Center of Fidelity Investments. Headquartered at Bangalore, where operations commenced in 2003, FMR India has another fully-functional unit at Chennai. To know more visit: FMR India
Location: Bangalore - Manyata/EGL / Chennai
Shift timings: 2:00 pm - 4:00pm

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
--------
About Us
--------

Blueshift ( https://blueshift.com/ ) is a venture-funded startup headquartered in San Francisco. Our AI-Powered marketing platform empowers cutting edge B2C brands to drive 1:1 marketing on every channel. With Blueshift, marketers are in full control of automating various forms of personalized messaging across every engagement channel.

Blueshift is trusted by leading digital brands like Udacity, LendingTree, BBC, and Paypal to automate their customer engagement marketing and recognized by Gartner as a "Cool Vendor for AI in Marketing".

Blueshift is founded by repeat entrepreneurs who previously built Mertado.com (acquired by Groupon to become Groupon Goods), and were part of the early team behind Kosmix (acquired by Walmart to become @WalmartLabs). We are backed by top-tier VCs including Nexus Venture Partners, Storm Ventures, Luma Partners, and SoftBank Venture Asia.

Blueshift has now started staffing a new development center in Pune, India. As part of Blueshift, you will get to work on cutting-edge technologies including machine learning, artificial intelligence, big data, and large-scale distributed data systems. This is an exciting opportunity for motivated individuals to build a great career.

--------------
AI/ML Engineer
--------------

Blueshift is looking for bold and self-motivated datascience engineers to join the team. You will have a chance to work on all aspects of big fast data systems, state of the art cloud infrastructure and cutting edge AI algorithms.

What are examples of work that Datascience Engineers have done at Blueshift?

AI algorithms: We have developed cutting edge AI based predictive models and state of the art recommender systems to deliver the right content, to the right audience, on the right channel, at the exact right time. This is a key driver to predictive marketing journeys. We have received a patent on our unique personalization approach and are recognized by the leading analyst from Gartner as Cool Vendor in AI Marketing.
Data management: Data sits at the core of our product. We ingest billions of user, product and behavior streams every day in real time. We perform ETL on the TBs of data to create schema-less user-product interaction graphs to compute product recommendations and predictive scores.
Cloud native Infrastructure: Framework to provision big data cloud infrastructure in a reproducible, version controlled, elastic and automated manner. Helps us scale our cluster easily. Also makes it easy to upgrade existing clusters or bring new clusters to play with the latest open source releases. We have provisioned our production Hadoop, Spark, Kafka and Druid clusters using this framework.
Open source: We love open source, our entire data infrastructure, and data science stack is built on open source. Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, S3, Kafka, Spark, Airflow, Druid, H2O.ai, Docker, and Redis forms our infrastructure and application stack.
----------------
Responsibilities
----------------

You will work on full stack data science components and applications such as ETL pipelines, recommendations, predictive targeting, auto-optimization
You will own, design and develop data infrastructure and applications to power cutting, edge AI algorithms over petabytes of data using offline/online data integration
You will build data products for growth and product marketers, think AWS services like AutoML for marketers
You will work with experienced technical and product teams with proven entrepreneurial success
As a first data science engineer in the team, you will have the opportunity to hire, mentor and lead the team
------------
Requirements
------------

Proven experience with distributed systems like Spark, Kafka, HDFS, Cassandra, Hive and HBase.
BS/Masters/PhD in Computer Science or related engineering disciplines
Strong architecture, algorithmic design and familiarity with open source AI/ML tools.
A real passion for thinking from first principles and building from ground up
Experience building a production ML systems would be a plus
------------------
Perks and Benefits
------------------

Opportunity to be part of the early team in India
Competitive salary
Stock option grants
Hospitalization and term insurance
Daily catered breakfast, lunch, and snacks along with well-stocked pantry

Title: Software-Senior Engineer(CPQ Architect)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
CPQ Technical Architect will work with business stakeholders and ITS colleagues in the implementation and support of Cloudsense CPQ at Telstra. This position offers diversity in projects, an opportunity to work in a team environment with autonomy and a high-level of responsibility. There are also excellent opportunities for professional growth and advancement within Telstra Customer Platforms and broader Telstra systems.
CPQ Technical Architect is responsible for leading technical CPQ low level architecture activities for Telstra across requirement analysis, design, development and implementation on Telstra’s key CRM platforms. They will be responsible for developing and coordinating technical delivery aspects of all Telstra’s CRM systems implementations, communicating effectively and fostering strong relationships with business users and stakeholders.
The purpose of the role is to take responsibility for ensuring all requests from the business are developed and delivered in the most optimal way taking into consideration business roadmaps, ITS CRM Strategy, industry best practice, vendor roadmaps and thought leadership and innovation delivering a competitive advantage to Telstra.
He will participate in and/or be responsible for technical analysis of functional designs, preparation of technical designs, technical build & implementation of CRM, CRM configuration and scripting, quality & code reviews, facilitating testing, resolution of defects identified during test, managing relationships between support and development team, mentoring and training
Key Accountabilities
Salesforce Technical Architect role is to plan, coordinate, and execute all activities related to the requirements interpretation, design and implementation of CPQ, CLM applications. This individual will apply proven industry and technology experience as well as communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to issues related to design, development, and deployment of mission-critical CRM systems with a focus on quality application development and delivery.
This role is key to the success of the Customer Platforms function at Telstra and will be responsible and accountable for the following:
Ability to design and develop Salesforce CRM, Cloudsense CPQ & Force.com Applications

Strong problem solving and analytical skills needed to support enterprise high availability Salesforce applications
Coordinate with technical resource within and outside of Customer Platforms team.

Review deliverables to verify that they meet client and contract expectations; Implement and enforce high standards for quality deliverables

working knowledge of all Atlassian tools a bonus

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Science & Algorithm Lab
Job Description - Data Scientist
About Conttext
Conttext enables a collaborative environment in its clients through its platform. Therapy is the flagship product from conttext, which is a platform for Healthcare collaborative across different stakeholders in a healthcare environment. Therapy healthcare provides in terms of connect, collaborate, and care thereby promoting value based care in their organization. From the provider’s perspective, Therapy helps in terms of knowledge retention, easy hand off of information, thereby enabling smooth transition and reducing patient wait times and enabling more time with patients than retrieval , verfication and sharing of data.
The Opportunity
Conttext is poised to grow rapidly, proving the product through customer beta, securing the first round of angel funding and stepping up its product development and sales machinery to reach more customers in the coming months.
we are looking for talented staff to join us and influence our product roadmap and operational outlook. There will be much more if you enjoy working in small teams whereby you see customers and influencers at close distance rather than through your binoculars.
Your Day at Work
At Conttext, we are working to simplify how business works, ensuring rhythm of collaboration across team cutting across multiple teams and types of machines, to start with in healthcare.
At Conttext, we want to build a world class Data & Algo Lab, wherein you will have an opportunity to be involved from Day 1 and will be part of the team which decides the strategy and modus operandi for our execution in Data Science.
Responsibilities :
Early member in Machine Learning Team involved in design, code, train, test, deploy and iterate on large scale machine learning systems.
Build delightful products and experiences for millions, while working alongside an excellent, cross-functional team across Engineering, Product and Design.
Help shape the direction of machine learning and artificial intelligence at Conttext
Qualifications :
BS and MS in Computer Science or related field with research in machine learning
Three years experience building machine learning or AI systems
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Solid software engineering skills across multiple languages including but not limited to Python, C/C++
Experience with machine learning software packages (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Caffe, Theano, Torch)
Experience with one or more of the following: natural language processing, deep learning, bayesian reasoning, recommendation systems, learning for search, speech processing, learning from semi structured data, reinforcement or active learning, ML software systems, machine learning on mobile devices

Title: Assistant Director_Senior Manager_ Automation Central
Description:
EY is a global professional services organization providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services.
EY is among the world's most attractive employers. It offers opportunities and experiences that bring out the best in its people at work every day. Collaborating with diverse teams across the globe helps our people develop a global mind-set. EY develops outstanding leaders who deliver value to all our stakeholders to meet their strategic corporate objectives.
GDS is EY's global client service delivery vehicle and is founded on an extended teaming model. With operations across the globe, GDS offers seamless services to 80 countries through its "high performing teams".
GDS India has won several Global HR awards for its people practices: ranked first in the "Dream Companies to Work”. For the sixth consecutive year, we've been ranked as the "Best Place to Work for" in the “Great Place to Work” survey.
GDS TAS has been one of the fastest growing services, delivering transaction diligence, capital transformation and corporate strategy services to clients around the world.
GDS TAS offers you:
First-hand knowledge on how the digital & economic climate is changing
Team of people with commercial acumen, technical experience and enthusiasm to learn new things in this fast-moving environment
An opportunity to be a part of market-leading, multi-disciplinary team of about 1,100 professionals in the only integrated global transaction business in India
Opportunities to work with EY TAS practices globally with leading businesses across a range of industries. We are committed to providing learning opportunities to our employees through robust training and global secondment opportunities
An environment that promotes and recognizes innovation and out-of-box thinking in developing solutions embedded with new-age technology
GDS India Data n’ Analytics Team
GDS TAS Data n’ Analytics team is a group of over 100 professionals proficient in a range of data analytics and automation technologies. It works as a centre of excellence for global TAS practices, as a thought leadership and tool engine to support new analytics tool development, process re-engineering and automation, financial analytics and user-focused visualization.

Primary responsibilities
Drive automation including process automation and intelligent automation in TAS services by working closely with TAS regional and global Innovation & Digital leaders

Overall 11-14 years of experience with expertise in range of automation and analytics technologies such as Blue Prizm, Automation Anywhere, and exposure to cognitive and artificial intelligence
10+ years of experience in managing large global cross-functional teams/projects, influencing senior level stakeholders
Master’s Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Administration or equivalent work experience

Software development experiences in Java and/or C/C++ as well as advanced databases
Experience in design, development and implementation of automation using Robotics, cognitive and artificial intelligence
Experience in Advanced Data Visualization tools, such as Tableau, Spotfire, Qlikview and others for integration between disparate data sources, design and implementation of KPIs and generation of automatic and scalable visualizations that will facilitate extraction of business insights.
Function, Client or Industry specific data exploitation concepts

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Strong project and people management skills with experience in serving global clients

Title: Sr Software Engineer - Productivity Tools
Description:
About Uber
At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together.
About the Role

We are looking for a software architect and core coding contributor to guide the development of
platforms for our enterprise products. Our mission is to enhance Uber’s speed, reliability and
worker happiness by building tools, integrations and platforms for internal use.

Why join us

People are Uber’s most important asset. Our team uses state of the art technology coupled with
Uber’s own world class platforms to create custom tools. We are building our own Identity and
Access Management Platform that provides ubiquitous, effective and efficient access to our apps
and services conforming to the highest standards of governance.
As an engineering leader, you’ll be instrumental in hiring, mentoring and inspiring a healthy team.
You’ll guide the technical growth of other engineers and establish the course for how Uber builds
reliable and innovative tools. In short, you’ll be making a massive impact on the world of
transportation from within - by engineering the backbone for a world class Uber work experience.
What you’ll do

Ideate and create innovate features that enhance the quality and overall performance of
existing internal products
Build Uber’s provisioning automation, access management and auditing platform to ensure
employees and contractors have exactly the tools they need, when they need them
Build Uber’s Identity Governance & Administration platform
Use machine learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) to predict and surface access
provisions, identify any internal security threats and misuse of access
Improve the ease and speed with which enterprise integrations can be planned, coded and
monitored by developing a secure, maintainable, easy-to-use integration platform that is
deeply connected to the rest of Uber’s microservice ecosystem
Use machine learning (ML) and other search technology to improve the quality of Uber’s
federated search results
Streamline the way data source owners can self-service the onboarding and customization of the search experience for their content

What you'll need
Minimum 7 years’ experience in building distributed, scalable, highly available, and robust
services and web applications
BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or a related field.
Strong belief and expertise in Agile SCRUM methodology
A passion for continuous improvement of yourself, your technology and the capabilities of
those around you
Expertise in Relational (MySQL) and non-relational(NoSQL) databases (Redis, Cassandra)
Proficient in object oriented and distributed programming techniques
Preferred languages: Python, Java, Go
Preferred front-end framework: React, HTML/CSS

Bonus points if

Experience with Machine Learning, Information Retrieval, Algorithmic Complexity, Data
mining, Pricing, Optimization
Prior experience working in or with Identity and Access Management Systems, Security
Access Manager, Identity Governance & Administration, Global Data Protection Regulation
(GDPR)
Prior experience working on products like Active Directory, OneLogin, Tivoli, Saviynt
Prior experience working on global projects, or in an international setting

Title: Java Full Stack Developer / Core Java / HTML / Java Script /...
Description:
Requisition ID: 218026
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Professional
Employment Type: Regular Full Time
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.
JOB TITLE: Developer - Cloud HCM Analytics Team
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES:
At SAP SuccessFactors we have started a Human Revolution. Using the latest technology, we are unlocking human potential and transforming our customer’s workforces in ways they never imagined. We are digitally transforming their businesses into the next generation of intelligent enterprises. Because people are at the heart of every business transformation and people are the heart of our business. The SAP SuccessFactors product suite spans core human resources and payroll, analytics-based hiring and customized onboarding, continuous performance management, intelligent succession and more. We operate the largest HCM Cloud in the world, supporting over 120 million users with over a billion transactions for customers across 26 industries in over 90 countries. Our co-located agile teams have end-to-end ownership of product, design, development, release, user assistance, and cloud operations capabilities. We are looking for the best talent to join our team and deliver continuous innovations in the cloud while bringing purpose to their lives and more meaning to their work. Join us today and become a part of the Human Revolution.
ABOUT THE TEAM
The Cloud HCM Analytics team builds the analytics solution on top of world’s biggest cloud-based enterprise application which has unique challenge in building a common solution that should be customizable for more than 4,450 across 60 industries in over 177 countries and scalable for 50 million users usage. We are responsible for building operational reporting solutions, as well as cutting edge analytical solutions. This team provides ample opportunities to interact with various stake holders and come of the best solution and implement the same with support for highly customizable and scalable approach. Current development activities involved in make use of Predictive Analytics, Machine learning and Artificial Intelligence. We have ambitious road map to start working on Prescriptive analytics.
Position Overview
Developers should be able to work as a Full stack developer with specialized either in UI or back end. Design highly scalable and performant solution which address functional as well as nonfunctional requirement with high quality.
Full stack developer – willing and capable of handling both client and server development
End to end responsibility – take care of your feature from requirements to deployment
Collaborate well – demonstrate excellent development practices, share and motivate others.
This development role provides immense potential for growth. The potential candidate would work closely with other members of the team and other functional groups within SAP SuccessFactors
SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Strong technical skills with technologies like Java/J2EE, Hibernate, Spring, SAP HANA, UI Technologies and OData protocols to develop modem cutting edge software that performs and scales in cloud environment
Server oriented - Knowledge in Java backend development (tomcat, JEE, dependency injection, and more) – mandatory
At least basic client-side knowledge of Web technologies, JS, HTML, CSS – mandatory.
Sound knowledge in Object Oriented Programming Principles, Design Patterns and Software Architecture, especially in new age Cloud solutions
Must be able to design and implement across all layers of the software (UI, Backend, Database)
Exposure to debugging, troubleshooting and performance tuning for complex SQL queries
Knowledge of lean development infrastructure process including Git, TeamCity, Jenkins etc. and exposure to Continuous Delivery practices
Exposure to building Analytical and report modelling for highly customizable Enterprise cloud-based SaaS application
Working knowledge of Scrum, Test Driven Development and passionate about unit test, integrity testing, stress testing and performance testing and test automation
Exposure to building large scale application deployed on public cloud like AWS, AZURE etc ..
EDUCATION, WORK EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS
BE/B.Tech, ME/M.Tech, MCA with 60% aggregate across.
Strong educational qualifications (Engineering majors, MCA from reputed institutes)
4-8 years of professional experience in developing Java/J2EE based enterprise web-based application,
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Bachelor’s in Computer Science required, Master preferred.
#SAPSFSF

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.
SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.
SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
Additional Locations:

Title: Senior Automation QA Engineer (Remote/Work-from-home)
Description:
WalletHub is one of the leading personal finance destinations in the US and rapidly growing. We’re looking for a motivated, hardworking, and competitive Senior Automation QA Engineer for a full-time, permanent position.
The expected work schedule is 7 AM to 7 PM EST Monday to Friday, including a 1h break.
Responsibilities
Testing and assuring high quality performance of website
Reporting and validating bugs for all components
Creating test plans and test cases
Creating and maintaining automated tests using Selenium and Java
Identifying opportunities for improvement and making constructive suggestions for change
Qualifications
You are the ideal candidate for this job if you have:
At least 3 years of hands-on experience in Test Automation with Java and Selenium
At least 4 years experience in Manual Testing
Excellent attention to details
Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Willingness to work hard
Proficient in written/spoken English
Compensation
Very competitive salary based on prior experience and qualifications
Potential for stock options after the first year
Raise and advancement opportunities based on periodic evaluations
The ability to work overtime for added income
100% remote position
Visa sponsorship (after 24 months with the company, based on performance, in case you will be working from outside the US)
How to apply
To get our attention, all you need to do is apply on Indeed and include your updated resume as well as a brief message telling us why you are the right candidate.If we believe that you will be a good match, we'll contact you to arrange the next steps of the application process.
Please know that we appreciate your interest in our company but due to the high number of applications we are unable to get back to candidates who have not been selected to move forward.
Note
This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed remotely from outside the U.S. without the need for U.S. work authorization.
More about WalletHub
WalletHub is a high-growth fintech company based in Washington, D.C. that is looking for talented, hard-working individuals to help us reshape personal finance. More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:
1) Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.
2) Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.
3) Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.
In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: ₹960,000.00 to ₹2,100,000.00 /year

Title: Git + AWS Cloud Engineer
Description:
Klizo Solutions develops mobile apps, websites, and software. We work in some really cool technology like facial recognition, artificial intelligence, and even blockchain. We have about 25 people in the team, and we are are doubling in size over the next couple months. We are looking for good people to join our rapidly growing company.
As a key member of our team, the AWS Cloud Engineer will work with development teams and other DevOps engineers to solve critical issues while improving customer experience. Other responsibilities include:
Build and support scalable microservices and system orchestration.

Title: Software-Senior Engineer(Big Data Architect)
Description:
About Telstra
Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, with operations in more than 20 countries, including in India where we’re building a new Innovation and Capability Centre (ICC) in Bangalore.
We’re combining innovation, automation and technology to solve the world’s biggest technological challenges in areas such as Internet of Things (IoT), 5G, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning, and more.
Join us on this exciting journey, and together, we’ll reimagine the future.
Role with us
This position offers diversity in projects, an opportunity to work in a team environment with autonomy and a high-level of responsibility. There are also excellent opportunities for professional growth and advancement within Telstra Customer Platforms and broader Telstra systems.
He would be responsible to develop, maintain, test and evaluate big data solutions within organisations and would be also involved in the design of big data solutions
He would builds large-scale data processing systems He would work on how algorithms work and have experience building high-performance algorithms.
The purpose of the role is to take responsibility for ensuring all requests from the business are developed and delivered in the most optimal way taking into consideration business roadmaps, ITS CRM Strategy, industry best practice, vendor roadmaps and thought leadership and innovation delivering a competitive advantage to Telstra
Key Accountabilities
Big Data Data Architect role is to plan, coordinate, and execute all activities related to the requirements interpretation, design and implementation of Big data and Machine Learning applications. This individual will apply proven industry and technology experience as well as communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to issues related to design, development, and deployment of mission-critical systems with a focus on quality application development and delivery.
This role is key to the success of the Customer Platforms function at Telstra and will be responsible and accountable for the following:
Ability to design and develop Big Data and Machine/Deep Learning Applications
Ability to review vendor designs and recommended solutions based on industry best practises
Ability to provide technical governance across Big Data and Machine/Deep Learning solutions at Telstra
Design and develop reusable, scalable and secure big data applications
Ensure optimized application performance with respect to throughput, cost and resource utilization
Develop and maintain real time streaming applications
Understanding of building, deploying and maintaining big data applications on cloud
Manage and administer Big data ecosystem
Create development artefacts including design document, release notes and POV
Assess and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the Big Data and Machine/Deep Learning application solutions to ensure user requirements and business objectives are met in a timely and cost effective manner
Understand overall business operations and develops innovative solutions to help improve productivity
Ability to understand and design provisioning solutions at Telstra and how CRM interacts with provisioning layers.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills needed to support enterprise high availability Salesforce applications
Coordinate with technical resource within and outside of B2B Digitisation.
Monitor process of software configuration/development/testing to assure quality deliverable.
Ensure standards of QA are being met
Review deliverables to verify that they meet client and contract expectations; Implement and enforce high standards for quality deliverables
Analyses performance and capacity issues of the highest complexity.
Demonstrate thought Leadership in Big data and Machine Learning.
Assists leadership with development and management of new application capabilities to improve productivity
Provide training and educate other team members around core capabilities and helps them deliver high quality solutions and deliverables/documentation
Self-Motivator to perform Design / Develop user requirements, test and deploy the changes into production
Skill & Experience : 10+ yrs
Experience with Data Modelling Tool like Erwin/MagicDraw, Hadoop Monitoring services, Hadoop Architecture Understanding, Hadoop Installation/ Service Management, Cluster Management, Unix/Python Scripting,
Technical Descriptors
Should be well versed with overall IT landscape, technologies and should be able to analyze how different technologies integrates with each other
Should be able to provided scalable and robust solution architecture depending on the needs
Should be able to compare tools and technologies and recommend a tool or technology
Must have good understanding of Data Structures, Distributed processing framework.
Must have experience of executing couple of big data projects (end to end)
Strong technical expertise and hands on experience on Hive, Flume, HBase & other Hadoop components
Candidate must have strong background & hands on experience of SPARK or JAVA or Data warehouse / ETL/BI or DWH appliances
Ability to work cross functionally to deliver appropriate resolution of technical, procedural, and operational issues.
Deep Knowledge of either Cloudera/ HortonWorks/ MapR/Pivotal
Deep Knowledge of developing Machine Learning & Deep Learning Models
Good knowledge of NoSQL Databases/ HBase/ MongoDB
Good knowledge of AWS Sagemaker, Tensorflow, Google Cloud Analytics
Good experience with at least one programming language like Scala, Java, Python, Pig etc
Proven expertise of delivering end to end projects working with virtual teams bonus
Why Join us
Our people in India will be at the forefront of technological change as they work collaboratively with, and learn from, world-class experts and have access to the latest training programs and insights for their field.
Alongside your work on leading edge projects, working with us means you'll have access to company perks and benefits that'll reward you for the great work you do. We’re growing, fast, and for you that means many exciting opportunities to develop your career with us at Telstra.
We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit tel.st/allrolesflex

Title: Sr Manager Application Modernization
Description:
The Company

Hitachi Vantara, a wholly owned subsidiary of Hitachi, Ltd., helps data-driven leaders use the value in their data to innovate intelligently and reach outcomes that matter for business and society – what we call a double bottom line. Only Hitachi Vantara combines 100+ years of experience in operational technology (OT) and 60+ years in IT to unlock the power of data from your business, your people and your machines. We help enterprises store, enrich, activate and monetize data for better customer experiences, new revenue streams and lower business costs

The Role

Looking for a Sr Manager Application Modernization
Responsibilities
1. Demonstrates history of creating and implementing technical solutions solving high value business problems for clients using data, the Cloud, modern software development methodologies and some forms of Big Data, data science (Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML)), Internet of Things (IOT).
2. Possesses depth in Big Data, data science (Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning), IOT and modern / Cloud native development.
3. Demonstrates the ability to help sales organizations to scope, solution and win highly complex and strategic technical projects.
4. Proven ability to manage relationships with technical and business leaders / executives and senior technical staff.
5. Demonstrates the ability to create methods and executing them to develop staff at all levels of software organizations into high performers.
6. Exhibits understanding of DevOps, Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment and other automation capabilities to drive operational efficiencies and achieve business outcomes.
7. Proven track record of Agile and Lean development within large enterprises as well as small teams.
8. Possesses experience and understanding of how to measure the performance of client facing software development and Big Data projects. Ability to measure success technically, programmatically and ensuring how to meet client’s tactical and strategic goals.
9. Understands how to identify and articulate business and technical value of innovative technologies, methodologies and other ideas to product management, marketing, sales and other business functions to help grow the Application Modernization and Digital Transformation group.
10. Articulates how Agile development, Lean decision making, automation, Cloud technologies and the four pillars of Cloud-native development, AI/ML, Big Data and IOT combine to enable digital transformation for firms.
11. Able to communicate key performance metrics, analysis and resolutions to the Global VP of Application Modernization, and other HV senior leadership.
12. Assists the Global VP of Application Modernization in identifying and determining regional and global strategies for growing business, margins and innovation output. Develops execution plans for their region.
Qualifications:

Should hold a bachelor's or master's degree, candidate experience level can range between 10-20 years

We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Title: Cloud SAAS Teach Lead
Description:
Who We Are

We are part of the Cisco’s Collaboration Technology Group (CTG), the #1 Global Leader in Collaboration Technologies, providing Best-in-Class integrated collaboration solutions that redefine the collaboration experience.
Our Customer Care Business Unit is an industry leader in the market in developing and delivering more intelligent customer and employee experiences at cloud speed and scale.
We are on a mission and hungry to hire A+ Engineers for our Cloud Software Group to -
o Articulate the next generation of Customer Care SaaS Solutions with us that will fundamentally change the way companies interact with their customers and will transform this multi-billion-dollar industry.

Who You Are

You are an extremely passionate coder with a deep flair for quality.
You write clean reusable code that’s easier to read, test and maintain.
You have been the lead on some critical modules.
You understand how your code helps drive the overall business.
You are a persistent problem solver.
‘Customers’ is your Top Priority.
You may not have solution to everything off hand but you know how to navigate a quickest path to get a solution to your problem.
You are a role-model; Teams look at your code and learn.
You get things done and never give up. You are self-driven and biased towards execution and delivery – taking on what needs to be done and owning it through to the end and beyond. You lead by example with your tenacity and extreme ownership ethic.
You are adept in converging and owning decisions/solutions quickly.
You have an impeccable eye to minute details and help your team better their code quality with your unprecedented reviews.
You possess a highly infectious energy, commitment and rigor.
You are comfortable at being uncomfortable and open to take risk.
You are fearless and challenge status-quo regardless of hierarchy.
You are the lieutenant to your architect and you have the drive to become the successor.

What You will be Doing

As part of our rapidly growing team, You'll work on leading cloud technologies and platforms spanning Cloud, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, Analytics, Integration, Connectivity, Messaging and more.
You will operate in an high performing environment with the latest in cloud development technologies and practices, including continuous delivery, continuous integration, test-driven development and PaaS based development.
Being an integral part of our Engineering team, you will work with –
With Engineering Teams
o You will build customer care solutions that provide rich experiences, connectivity, and automation
o You will write code, deliver high quality, high value software and focus on continuous value delivery.
o You will mentor other Engineers and review their code.
o You will ensure 360 evaluation of code including Static Analysis, Code Complexity, Junits, automation using state-of-art development tools and technologies.
With Architect
o You will work with Architect to ensure your design has conformance in all aspects and fits into the overall solution.
o You will groom the backlog for your team.
o You will own and architect multiple modules of the solution and you will architect the entire solution in architect’s absence.
With Technical Leadership Team
o You will help shape the architectural vision for the product.
o You will ensure architectural/design alignment with other interacting components.
o You will identify technical debt in your components and create a strategy to systematically reduce them.
With External Teams
o Wherever dependencies exist, you will work with external teams (Engineering) to complete your deliverables.
o You will promptly unblock the external teams that are dependent on your deliverables.
With Product Marketing
o You will work with Product Marketing to connect the business requirements to technical solutions and vice versa.
o You will be the proxy
Customer Success Team
o You will work closely with Customer Solutions Assurance and Technical Assistance Teams to address customer issues with Top priority.
o You will continuously learn from field experiences and bridge the gaps in code and validation.
With People Leadership
o You will be an integral part of the hiring team and help in uplifting the team’s capabilities and skill diversity.
How will you Succeed
o By producing a high quality design and writing high quality wow inducing code.
o By designing solutions to your modules that is robust, scalable, maintainable and serviceable.
o Through continuous value delivery
o Creating a architectural vision for your components
o By clea
o By mentoring teams and reviewing their code to ensure overall quality of software.
o By helping in hiring efforts and upskilling the teams that enables a good cross-learning culture.

Join our Force if you have –
12+ years of software engineering experience with recent work on Full Stack development
Experienced at developing highly available and reliable cloud based applications using Java/Scala
Have successfully implemented APIs and user interfaces using Node.js, REST, Java, JavaScript, and React
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
Experience with instrumenting code for cloud deployments
Experienced with some of the following: Cassandra, Elasticsearch, and/or Redis
Experienced developing services on AWS, OpenStack, Cloud Foundry, Heroku, or similar
Experience with Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing a plus
Understanding of security technology and challenges a plus
